job description:
About the job
DATA SCIENTIST
We are growing our data science team to help Tendam (Cortefiel, Pedro del Hierro, Springfield, women¬¥secret, Fifty, Hoss Intropia, Dash&Stars, Hi&BYE, OOTO y Slow Love) solve challenging problems from the retail fashion industry. We are now seeking a Data Scientist for a unique opportunity of impacting the way the world experiences fashion.

What will you do?
1. Decompose complex data problems and conduct rigorous analysis and evaluations
2. Undertake preprocessing of structured and unstructured data
3. Mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies.
4. Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets
5. Present information using data visualization techniques

What are we looking for?
1. Scientific background with computational and analytical skills
2. Strong problem solving skills with emphasis on analyzing issues, identifying causes, and recommending solutions quickly
3. Programming skills with Python and SQL
4. Understanding and experience with big data systems, especially with Spark (PySpark)
5. Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, regression, decision trees, neural networks, etc.)
6. Experience with cloud based web services (e.g., AWS)
7. Experience working with huge amounts of data
8. Experience with data visualization tools and packages.
9. Strong ability with data-reporting tools such as Excel and building reports (Quicksight, Tableau‚Ä¶)
10. Knowledge and experience with a version control system (e.g. Git)
11. Excellent written and verbal communication skills
12. Collaborative spirit and the ability to communicate complex ideas effectively to both colleagues and stakeholders
13. A drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques.

Extra qualifications
1. Knowledge and/or experience in the fashion retail industry

Why coming to Tendam?
1. One of the largest customer data repositories in industry: more than 20M Club members
2. Working with multiple different data sources: purchases, marketing campaigns, products, web navigation, apps, etc
3. Building machine learning models for real world problems: have a real impact in the business!
4. Working with cutting edge technologies
5. Exposure to agile methodologies
6. Working in a challenging and dynamic industry
7. A great team!

UBICACI√ìN: oficinas centrales de Madrid (zona norte accesibles en metro, cercan√≠as y autobuses urbanos).
CONTRATO: Indefinido.
Horario: jornada flexible de lunes a jueves de 7:30-9:30h y salida entre 17-19h, viernes jornada intensiva durante todo el a√±o, de 7:30-9:30h y salida entre 13-15h.
Disponemos de comedor de empresa, descuento para empleados y buen ambiente laboral.

job description:
About the job
TELUS International is looking for Language Data Analysts in Barcelona, Spain to work onsite for a machine learning project! At the moment, we are looking for candidates with fluency in Danish . For this position, we also offer relocation assistance .

Language Data Analysts will analyze data in a given language and identify potential issues. They will also collaborate with international testing teams and engineers to help reproduce issues and test features. Data obtained will be used to train and improve speech recognition and AI systems.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

Includes, but is not limited to the following. Other duties may be assigned.

Linguistic data labelling.
Analyzing language data in the given language and identifying potential issues and patterns.
Collaborating with an international testing team and engineers to help reproduce issues and test features.
Communicating with various departments.

SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS:

Fluency in Danish .
Preferred educational background: linguistics, literature or translation.
Available to work onsite in Barcelona, Spain.
Excellent reading, writing and comprehension skills in English; ability to understand and closely follow elaborate guidelines in English.
In-depth knowledge of native culture and history, staying up to date with day-to-day news and happenings in the target country and regular use of the language required.
Strong attention to detail and ability to meet project targets.
Self-motivated and able to work as part of the team or independently.
Good computer and software skills across different operating systems.
Strong typing skills.
Good organizational skills
Adaptable to changing environments.

WHAT WE OFFER:

Attractive salary
Relocation assistance

No overtime or weekend work

If this opportunity sounds appealing to you, apply now! Kindly attach your CV in English.

Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

ABOUT US:

AI Data Solutions

Creating and enhancing the world's data to enable better AI via human intelligence.

We strive to enhance the world's data to enable better AI through human intelligence. Our team of data, technology, and project management professionals work with companies to test and improve machine learning models. We handle various data types, including text, images, audio, video, and geo. TELUS International values diversity and grants equal opportunity regardless of age, civil status, disability, gender, nationality, race, religion and political beliefs, sex or sexual orientation.

TELUS International is looking for Danish Language Data Analysts in Barcelona, Spain.

At TELUS International, we enable customer experience innovation through spirited teamwork, agile thinking, and a caring culture that puts customers first. TELUS International is the global arm of TELUS Corporation, one of the largest telecommunications service providers in Canada. With global call center delivery capabilities, our multi-shore, multi-language programs offer safe, secure infrastructure, value-based pricing, skills-based resources and exceptional customer service - all backed by TELUS, our multi-billion dollar telecommunications parent.

Equal Opportunity Employer

At TELUS International, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire and promote, are based on applicants‚Äô qualifications, merits, competence and performance without regard to any characteristic related to diversity.

job description:
About the job
Do you live in Spain and want to earn extra income?

Peroptyx is a provider of data and evaluation solutions used by global technology and financial enterprises to build the most locally relevant, safest and intuitive online services for their customers.

We are currently looking for freelance / independent contractors to join our community of Data Analyst in Map Applications. This role offers flexible opportunities with competitive rates. The position will allow you to work from home with a schedule that minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Data Analyst in Map Applications, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you! We are currently looking for freelancers as
Data Analyst - Map Evaluator (home office)
Part-time position, freelancer/self-employed basis, home office

The Role
¬∑ You will complete tasks related to online maps and route planning for Spain.
¬∑ You will classify/evaluate the data in relation to these tasks.
¬∑ You will use online tools to examine the accuracy of geographic queries, addresses and routes.
¬∑ To qualify for this position, you will first need to successfully complete an online entrance exam.

Ideal Candidate
Fluent in Spanish and English.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Spain
Analytical mindset.
Job Requirements
Must be living in Spain for the last 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
Anti-virus solution that is kept up to date, with regular scans performed
All products will be provided at your own expense
Only one member per household may apply
Benefits
Work up to 20 hours per week. #homeoffice #nationwide #backtowork #
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!
Are you looking for flexible working hours? Would a second income or rewarding experience come in handy as a career booster? Then apply now!

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

job description:
About the job
JR0114179

Data Analysis - Product Performance Associate ) ‚Äì Madrid, Spain

Are you ready to play a pivotal role using your analytical skills to ensure growth and success across our Financial Ecosystem in Europe? Do you have a passion for innovation and for using data to drive commercial success? If so, why not consider joining Western Unions‚Äô new Digital Banking hub as a Data Analysis - Product Performance Associate .

Western Union powers your pursuit.

In this unique role for the new pan-European Ecosystem you will play a critical role in ensuring the success of our digital banking product by tracking and analyzing performance metrics, identifying trends and opportunities for improvement, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to drive product optimization.

Role Responsibilities
Using a wide range of data, you will be identifying trends and insights to inform product optimization and growth strategies.
You will collaborate with Product Management Team to establish performance metrics and KPIs for our digital banking product.
You will work with cross-functional teams, including product, marketing, and technology, to identify and prioritize product improvements and enhancements.
You will conduct market research and competitor analysis to stay up to date with industry trends and best practices.
You will communicate product performance insights and recommendations to key stakeholders and partners, and you will have an active role in the product reporting cycles.
Role Requirements
For this important role you will have 5+ years of professional experience in data analysis, performance analysis or a related field, although candidates with other relevant experience will be considered.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with experience using data to inform decision-making.

=
You demonstrate experience with mobile and web tools, and experience in digital banking propositions, market trends, and the competitve landscape.

Excellent written and spoken English and Spanish are essential and all other language skills are welcomed.
We make financial services accessible to humans everywhere. Join us for what‚Äôs next.

Western Union is positioned to become the world‚Äôs most accessible financial services company ‚Äîtransforming lives and communities. To support this, we have launched a Digital Banking Service and Wallet across several European markets to enhance our customers‚Äô experiences by offering a state-of-the-art digital Ecosystem. More than moving money, we design easy-to-use products and services for our digital and physical financial ecosystem that help our customers move forward.

Just as we help our global customers prosper, we support our employees in achieving their professional aspirations. You‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to learn new skills and build a career, as well as receive a great compensation package. If you‚Äôre ready to help drive the future of financial services, it‚Äôs time for Western Union. Learn more about our purpose and people at https://careers.westernunion.com/

Benefits

You will also have access to short-term incentives, multiple health insurance options, accident and life insurance, and access to best-in-class development platforms, to name a few

(https://careers.westernunion.com/global-benefits/). Please see the location-specific benefits below and note that your Recruiter may share additional role-specific benefits during your interview process or in an offer of employment.

Your Spain Specific Benefits Include
25 days annual leave ‚Äì plus 14 public holidays
Comprehensive life & medical cover ‚Äì including dependents.
Contributory pension plan
Preventative Care Assistance program
We are passionate about diversity. Our commitment is to provide an inclusive culture that celebrates the unique backgrounds and perspectives of our global teams while reflecting the communities we serve. We do not discriminate based on race, color, national origin, religion, political affiliation, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, age, disability, marital status, or veteran status. job description:
About the job
Locaria blends insight, data, talent and technology to take global content further for ambitious brands.

We are a pioneering multilingual content activation agency which specializes in supporting marketing and e-commerce teams, media agencies and creative production houses. We are central to the global content solution of Stagwell, the challenger advertising network.

Home to the Association of Translation Companies' Innovator of the Year
Shortlisted for three business awards by The Drum
Named "Best Workplace for Training & Personal Development" by Adaptive
Every day we celebrate the power of amazing content to engage global audiences. At the heart of this is our diverse global team across ten offices, who believe in our vision that content is an indispensable, strategic service. At the heart of our collaborative culture are our values, which inform everything we do.

If you love great content, understand the importance of local language and culture, and want to be part of a dynamic team, then this is the place for you.

The Role

We are looking for Junior Data Scientist to join our team and assist in the development and implementation of data-driven solutions. The successful candidate will have a strong foundation in statistics and programming and be proficient in R and Python. Additionally, this person will have experience with SQL (specifically AWS Athena / Presto), GitHub (CI/CD), time series forecasting and statistical modelling.

The Junior Data Scientist will work alongside our Data Team to help develop, maintain and analyse our data infrastructure.

Key responsabilities

Develop and maintain statistical models for data analysis and forecasting
Collaborate with senior data scientists to implement data-driven solutions
Assist in the development of data infrastructure, including data processing, cleaning, and management
Perform ad-hoc data analysis and support business initiatives with data-driven insights
Develop and maintain data visualisations to communicate insights to stakeholders
Utilise GitHub for version control, Continuous Integration (CI), and Continuous Deployment (CD)
Collaborate with other teams to gather requirements and ensure data quality and accuracy
Conduct thorough statistical analysis and generate reports to support data-driven decision making
Continuously monitor, maintain, and improve existing data processes and models


Requirements

Bachelor's degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science or equivalent practical experience
Strong proficiency in R and Python programming languages
Experience working with SQL and familiarity with AWS Athena / Presto
Knowledge of Digital Marketing
Client-facing experience showcasing data science projects
Experience with GitHub, specifically version control, Continuous Integration (CI), and Continuous Deployment (CD)
Strong foundation in statistics and statistical modelling, including time series forecasting
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Preferred skills

Experience with machine learning techniques and algorithms
Experience with data visualisation tools.
Knowledge of data governance and security best practices
Some degree of Familiarity with cloud computing platforms such as AWS, Azure or GCP
Share our values

We take content further
We grow together
Celebrating Individuality
Doing good along the way
With care
D&I statement

Locaria is global by nature and vastly strengthened by multicultural, international and eclectic teams. Working together to achieve shared goals, our employees recognise the importance of our core value ‚Äòcelebrating individuality', and are supported by Locaria's breadth of cultural resources and insights that attract and retain the best talent.

We appreciate the unique perspectives and experiences that each person brings to our team and are fully committed to ensuring equal opportunities across the board, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability and gender identity. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let our team know.

Join our team and become part of a vibrant workplace and company culture that values and celebrates individuality!#



Benefits

In return for your enthusiasm and expertise, we can offer an exciting and multicultural place of work, competitive salary, wide range of benefits, and the chance to progress your career within a truly global organization.


Some of these benefits include:

Holiday: You will be entitled to 22 working days paid leave per year (pro-rata in first year), excluding public holidays.
Flexible Working: Opportunities to work from home up to 3 days a week through our Flexible Working Policy, and to work from anywhere as part of our Abroad Working Policy.
Refer a Friend Scheme: We're always on the lookout for talented people. If you refer a friend who is then hired, we will award you with a bonus of up to 2,000 Euros depending on the level of the role being recruited for.
Birthday Day Off: As a gift from us you will receive an extra day off for your birthday each year. If your birthday falls on a weekend, then you can take this the Friday before or Monday after.
Rest and recharge: The option to lengthen your standard 1 hour lunch break by 30 minutes, as long as you maintain the same number of hours you work a day.
Time off to volunteer: In line with our 'Doing Some Good Along The Way' value, all employees are entitled to up to 2 days off a year to get involved in charity initiatives.
Annual Wellbeing and Learning & Development Calendars: We promote a healthy working environment with a focus on growth, which is why we have a calendar with dedicated Wellbeing and Learning & Development sessions and initiatives throughout the year
Equipment: You will be equipped with a laptop, extra screen, mouse and keyboard.

Desired Skills and Experience
Analyst
Data scientist
Junior Data Scientist

job description:
About the job
We are looking for a highly skilled Business Data Analyst who is experienced with anticipating and detecting issues with data, with strong experience in SQL to ensure harmonisation of data ingestion and data consistency within their platform. This role is partnered with one of our top global pharmaceutical companies in Spain.

Responsibilities:

Ensure data ingestion harmonization across the different analytical platforms, starting with Adobe Campaign and Adobe Analytics datasets
Check data integrity and consistency and will make the level of matching among environments as visible as needed to users, stakeholders and partners via scoring and reporting
Address every detected issue to the indicated teams and follow-up the resolution
Support regions understanding their demands or issues and figuring out the best possible solution according to scalability and simplicity principles
Contact Focus Areas owners and Adobe platform managers in order to anticipate potential impacts among the different platforms due to evolutions or maintenance tasks


And the desired skills are:

Mind-structured and methodic in order to detect any potential issue whatever the stage is
+4 years using SQL, +1 year using Python or R
Deep knowledge around data reading techniques on AWS cloud and SnowFlake with large volumes of data
Strong experience on the business side, not a developer role
Previous experience deploying similar solutions covering data quality checks and integrity
Familiar with other relational DBMS like Oracle, SQL Server and data modeling strategies like star schema or vault
Capacity to influence providers, partners or stakeholders without authority
Previous knowledge around Adobe solutions like Campaign or Analytics will be highly valued
Good communication skills
Fluent English

If you are a self-motivated individual who is passionate about data analytics, we want to hear from you. Please submit your application today to join our team and help us maintain the highest standards of data analytics in the pharmaceutical industry.

If you have the skills and experience for this opportunity, then please apply or email Loren your CV today to loren.cardy@hayburysearch.com.

Loren is a Client Partner at Haybury Search covering Europe, UK, North America and Asia.

job description:
About the job
Who We Are:
AKDM is a leader in delivering digital growth strategies guided by data, analytics, and business intelligence. We work with a range of clients ‚Äî spanning niche players to industry leaders across e-commerce, financial services, travel, entertainment, and consumer packaged goods.

Inclusivity for our teams is a priority. From DEI training to volunteering, we are on a journey to connect our business goals with values by promoting a culture of equity and access. We are actively seeking candidates that bring diverse perspectives to our team and work with us to build better, more inclusive approaches to work and collaboration.

About the Role:
As a Web Analyst, designing and implementing tracking solutions doesn‚Äôt intimidate you. You thrive in this role when you‚Äôre able to track across a wide variety of platforms, collaborate with teams across disciplines, and help establish a data-driven culture of measurement. Your passion for figuring out better ways to track key user actions that directly impact ROI provides the basis for many crucial downstream processes; complex analysis, data products, and measurement of digital marketing performance.


Responsibilities:
Develop measurement best practices and technology requirements to generate high quality, easily-understood implementation guides for deployments of analytics implementations.
Partner with client engineering teams to audit analytics implementations, troubleshoot tracking issues, and define quality assurance tests to optimize reporting effectiveness.
Collaborate closely with AKDM‚Äôs digital marketing teams to enhance tracking capabilities and ensure that data is accurately tracked through all pipelines and reporting endpoints.
Serve as the resource for setting up new analytics implementations, defining how they are similar, and how they are radically different to internal and external teams.
Actively focus on the future-proofing, scalability, and ease of maintenance in all analytics implementations.
Maintain a repository of high quality technical deliverables, methodologies and business development documents.
Stay up to date with industry trends (such as iOS14 and server-side tagging) within the analytics space.

Competencies:
Undergraduate degree or any equivalent combination of education and experience.
1-2 years of analytics implementation with an understanding of the digital marketing or ad tech space (i.e. attribution models, feed based marketing, pixel based marketing).
Comprehensive knowledge of JavaScript and an understanding of popular libraries and frameworks to enhance analytics deployment.
Understanding of common data layer methodology, designing a cohesive data model (data layer) and interpreting a solution design document.
Extensive experience with analytics tools such as Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, and Amplitude.
Extensive experience with marketing and advertising engines such as Facebook, Google (Ads, CM360, SA360), Bing, Tiktok, Pinterest, Snapchat, Twitter, Reddit, and Criteo.
Extensive experience with tag management systems such as Google Tag Manager, Tealium, or Dynamic Tag Management.
Familiarity with deploying and testing analytics tools in mobile apps for iOS and Android devices, especially using the Firebase SDK.
Proven critical thinking, analytical problem-solving skills, and attention to detail.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to bridge the gap between technology and business management.
Familiarity with web technologies and website infrastructure (data layers, HTTP protocol, DevTools, cookies, client/server interactions, asynchronous website, etc..).
Ready to be part of a tight-knit, growing team; ambitious, can work independently as well as collaboratively and possess interpersonal skills.

Nice to Haves:
Experience with front-end development, including customizing templates for popular content management platforms such as WordPress, Shopify, Magento, Drupal, and more.
Experience with one or more data visualization tools, including Tableau, PowerBI, or Data Studio.
You love to figure out ways to automate work processes and have some familiarity with SQL.
Experience working in a startup environment with exceptional multi-tasking and context-switching capabilities.

What We Provide For Spain Employees:
Funded Pension Plan
30 calendar days for PTO
13th & 14th month salary
Holidays: We observe all major Spain holidays and encourage our employees to celebrate their cultural and ethnic traditions without having to take PTO
Paid Parental Leave: We provide 16 weeks paid leave for primary caregivers
Mentorship Program: Mentees receive one-on-one support from the leadership team to receive practical advice and guidance in developing future career goals
Flexible work from home policy


What We Value:
At AKDM we believe diversity is essential to crafting digital strategies. We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, gender, ethnicity, citizenship, national origin of employees, religion, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, veteran status or any other legally protected status.

job description:
About the job
A better internet, where privacy is the default, is possible. Building this better internet might seem daunting or even unthinkable, but at Proton, this is what we do every day.

Proton was founded in 2014 by a group of scientists who met at the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). Our first product, Proton Mail, is now the world‚Äôs largest encrypted email service. Subsequent Proton products, such as Proton VPN, Proton Calendar, and Proton Drive, give our users full control over how and with whom their data is shared.

Today, Proton makes privacy universally accessible. Journalists from outlets like The Guardian and The New York Times , some of the world‚Äôs largest organizations, and people in more than 180 countries have signed up for over 70 million accounts. Our diverse and dynamic team is made up of more than 400 members representing over 40 different nationalities. While we are based in Geneva, Switzerland, we have offices in Zurich, Prague, London, Vilnius, Skopje, Taipei, and many more employees working remotely around the world.

Join one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing companies to help us solve challenging problems and build new products that will reach hundreds of millions of people. We want to create more than just one of the world‚Äôs most impactful tech companies; we want to create a new internet that serves the interests of all people. We need you, your voice, your ideas, and your ambition to make it happen.

Purpose of the role

We are looking for a talented data analyst to help us support data-driven decision-making across the company. You will be embedded within a business unit (Mail, VPN, Drive, Growth, etc) and will play a key role in understanding our customers, guiding the team in their decision-making, and driving the implementation of new features and growth initiatives. As part of the data team, you will also collaborate with data science and data engineering in improving our data platform.

What You Will Do

Lead colleagues to the right decision by using data
Assemble, clean, and manage large, complex datasets from different data sources
Apply tools and techniques for data analysis and visualization
Represent and summarize data and findings in the most appropriate format
Research new use cases for already existing data, and provide feedback on new data sources to be incorporated
Collaborate with the data science team in developing advanced analytics applications for the business unit
Share findings and best practices for your business unit with analysts in other business units

Job Requirements

Bachelor's degree or higher in a quantitive (statistics, mathematics, physics, engineering, computer science, etc) or financial discipline.
Strong analytical skills
Experience in business intelligence, product analytics, marketing KPIs, or web analytics
at least 3 years of relevant working experience in the field
Advanced knowledge of SQL
Good knowledge of a BI tool, preferably Tableau
Good knowledge of Python is a plus
Open-minded, ready to test and implement new ideas

Why should you join Proton?

Be part of a movement - Proton is not just a product or service but a community-driven movement united by a shared vision of online freedom. Our services are open source, audited, and supported by community contributions. We give back to our community by maintaining core encryption libraries and by supporting other organizations furthering the same goals as us. Proton is free, open source, neutral, independent, and community first, while remaining financially sustainable.
Work with smart and dedicated people - Our team is diverse, collaborative, and tight-knit with people coming from all walks of life, including many of the world‚Äôs top academic institutions and organizations, such as MIT, Harvard, Stanford, Caltech, Cambridge, and ETH.
Join a strong brand - Our encrypted email service - Proton Mail - has grown to be a staple of online security and privacy. Proton has been featured in multiple popular television and film productions, such as Mr. Robot, Knives Out, Sounds of Metal, and more.
Grow with us - We‚Äôre one of Europe‚Äôs fastest-growing startups, doubling in size every year. Our growth gives you limitless career and educational opportunities as well as the opportunity to work side-by-side with many world-leading experts in their fields.
Have your voice heard - We value your opinion and encourage you to speak up and share your ideas and thoughts. At Proton, no problem is someone else‚Äôs problem. We collectively strive to do the right thing and be the undisputed best in the world at everything we do.
Benefits ‚Äì these vary by location and type of contract but expect support on your vacation, parental leave, refreshment if working from the office, learning and development opportunities, equity for shared success, flexible working hours and remote work, company events and team building activities.

Proton does not accept unsolicited resumes from any sources other than directly from a candidate. Proton will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited offer, even in a situation when the relevant candidate is employed by Proton.

job description:
About the job
TUI Group is the world‚Äôs number one integrated tourism business. Accommodation Sourcing is a global team within TUI technology responsible for the connectivity and sourcing of hotel and accommodation portfolio. We are a multi-disciplinary team of experts across Architecture, Engineering, DevOps and Agile Delivery providing services across the UK, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, Belgium and The Netherlands.

At TUI we‚Äôre ambitious to become the leader in technology within the travel industry and to achieve this we are looking to build a capable, creative team who want to be a part of accomplishing that goal.


We never stop looking ahead, seeking new ways to delight our customers and grow our business. We recognise the power of digital and the massive contribution this brings to creating a truly unique and differentiated customer experience.


The Business Analyst is a critical thinker with a keen eye for detail. Actively consulting with stakeholders, probing to create and communicate a common understanding of the problem that needs solving. Working within a fast-paced agile environment, the Business Analyst thinks outside of the box, loves collaborating across teams and is a lifelong learner.

The Business Analyst in the supplier connectivity environment is a primarily a technical role. A general technical understanding of data exchange via APIs is required as well as reading and working with technical data exchange formats. The specification and design of data models and the data flow between different micro services as well as the mapping of business-related data is one of the core tasks for the Business Analyst.

ABOUT THE JOB:

As a Business Analyst, you are part of a cross-functional team that delivers micro service driven backend solutions from conception to operation. You will collaborate with business analysts, software developers, architects, stakeholder, business partners and tech experts to clearly define, document and communicate requirements that will enable implementation of new changes and enhancements to our digital platforms in an agile manner.

You‚Äôre responsible for evaluating solution options, consulting with stakeholders as needed to define and articulate business needs in a way that enables the design and delivery of technical solutions that add value across TUI global platforms and services. You use your deep understanding of TUI products and systems, business models, processes, data flows and their link to business capabilities to plan and deliver high quality business analysis that supports the ongoing delivery of growth and digital transformation across our key markets.

Working alongside a varied set of technology and business stakeholders, you define and document new business, user, and system requirements, considering impacts to upstream/ downstream services. You manage the requirement lifecycle from planning through to elicitation, testing, delivery, and business acceptance. You can provide business analysis to multiple scrum-oriented delivery teams and work closely with the technology lead to prioritise and manage complex backlogs.

As a Business Analyst you distil the needs of business and using your strong collaboration skills you support your team to deliver the best solutions to our customers‚Äô needs. You are commercially astute, focusing on solving business problems in the best way.

You love to work in an international, multi-cultural team. You challenge constructively and have high expectations of yourself and others. You always drive for excellence, ownership and self-organisation at‚ÄØteam‚ÄØand personal level.‚ÄØ You love to learn and acquire new skills and keep up to date with latest developments in your focus areas. You‚Äôre an active member in the Business Analyst community.

Security is part of everyone‚Äôs job. At TUI, we practise secure behaviours first in everything we do.

ABOUT YOU:

Strong analytical skills and commercial acumen. Adept at understanding complex problems and communicating findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders
Collaborative approach, able to balance the needs of multiple stakeholders and facilitate agreement across multiple markets in a global structure
Proficient at using requirements elicitation methods including business process modelling (BPM), UML, test/use cases and prototyping
Experience creating, analysing and validating detailed functional specifications and elements of systems design; including data rules, data models, data flow processes, business rules, wireframes or other detailed deliverables that articulate how a business need should be satisfied
Good track record of successfully using requirements elicitation and communication techniques including workshop facilitation, documentation analysis, interviewing and brainstorming
Good Knowledge of technical data exchange formats like JSON, XML and YAML
Experience with technical API-technologies like REST and SOAP and corresponding tools like Postman
Knowledge of touristic data formats like EDF and OTA would be helpful
Familiar with database queries (SQL), micro service architecture and AWS services
Demonstrable experience of creating user stories, epics and acceptance criteria/scenarios within a scrum-oriented environment
A good understanding of agile and flexible software delivery methodology, tools and techniques and the software development lifecycle including knowledge of Scrum and Kanban
Customer centric, passionate about delivering great digital products and services
Passionate about continuous improvement
Open minded, inquisitive, life-long learner
Comfortable with ambiguity, highly autonomous

About Our Offer

Competitive salary
Pension scheme and life assurance
Generous holiday entitlement & holiday discounts
Forward thinking ways of working
TUI time off, purchase of additional holiday entitlement
Excellent rates with foreign exchange and discounts with retailers

We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA

If you require any further information regarding this opportunity, please email recruitment@tui.co.uk

position: Mid Data Analyst/Engineer at Factorial HR
job description:
About the job
Hi there üëã

As Factorial continues on our mission of boosting the next generation of people-first SMB's, we're hiring a mid level Data Analyst Engineer to help.

The Team and you

Factorial's mission is to empower businesses to make better decisions, and data is a key component in doing so.

You‚Äôll be part of two teams:
the Data team as they are your peers,
The Core domain: you will bring your data engineering & analysis expertise to that product vertical in particular, specialising in those business questions.

Data engineers are responsible of unlocking communication between the different areas despite the technological stack by offering a self-service platform that allows fast data-driven products. We act under the data mesh principle and we're not afraid to build whatever is necessary to fulfil our partner team's needs. Our data platform is already offering the following services:
Ingestion (SaaS APIs, DDBBs, Streams)
Storage (Data Lake, Stream Storage)
Catalogue (Atlan)
Modeling (Metabolic)
Activation (Hightouch)
Exploration & Visualization (Preset)
On-demand Data Products (TinyBird)

We're looking for Data Engineers to enable the product and engineering team to use these and future services, and to assist them in making data a first-class citizen.

The Role

At Factorial, we have a team of +150 very talented developers. We are looking for engineers who can wear many hats, abstract problems, and find creative solutions. We look for smart people who are curious, proactive and have good soft/communication skills.

We are not looking for a long list of skills and technologies. Our web stack is Ruby on Rails for the backend and React/React-native for the clients, and we interact with Data through SQL on AWS, but it's not mandatory to be proficient in those (most of the team came with other areas of expertise which is very enriching). We believe that someone who has good aptitudes and is hungry for learning is what works best.

If you're looking for new challenges in a people-first company no matter where you live, this is what to expect:
You will evangelise the use of our Data Platform among technical users and empower the creation of Factorial's next Data Products.
You will help stakeholders analyse their data: as you grow more comfortable in the business domain, you will be able to ask the right questions as well as craft the queries to answer them.
You will listen, identify and evaluate new requirements from Stakeholders (Engineering, Product, Management, Sales, Customer Experience, Marketing, Growth).
You will occasionally contribute in managing the platform from a DataOps point of view.

Your profile
You are a team player: You are comfortable helping your teammates, sharing your knowledge, reviewing their code and asking for reviews of your own.
You have a user-centric mindset: You know that the only reason we write code is to help the users of Factorial to perform their tasks.
You like relaxed and fun environments: We work hard and we are committed to Factorial users but we do that in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. We don't take ourselves too seriously.
You are a learner: You want to improve your skills not only in the engineering field but across any other areas.
You are an owner: You like proposing new hypotheses and be responsible for building, deploying and validating them.
You love understanding: Breaking down complex problems into basic and shareable elements and you have evolved concrete implementations to abstractions before.
You are a polyglot developer: You have experience in several coding languages, CI/CD tools and cloud technologies.
You are a mentor: You love to share your experience and expertise to help others grow.
You are comfortable communicating in English.

Your background
Experience in building a modern Data Platforms
Functional programming in Scala (or any other JVM language).
Spark development, especially Structured Streaming, or equivalent (Flink, Beam, Samza,...)
Hands-on with Kafka.

Nice-to-haves:
Knowledge of the AWS Analytics Stack (Glue, S3, Athena, Redshift, Kinesis, Lake Formation)
Advanced Analytical SQL knowledge.
Some alternative coding experience, ideally with a background of web development.
Some infrastructure as code experience, ideally with Terraform on Cloud
GitOps driven mentality and data CI/CD ideas.

At Factorial we don't evaluate you by the years of experience you have, we evaluate your knowledge and skills.

How are we doing it? We have a Career Path with a rubric framework where we define what is expected for each experience level and skill we're evaluating. This framework will allow you to know at which level you're right now and what do you need to continue growing in the company.

As we care deeply about transparency (it's one of our hiring values), our Career Path includes the salaries for each level and we share it during the first interview to make sure we're aligned.

We're a remote-first engineering team company so you can apply from anywhere in the world and English is our official language so this is the only one you need to succeed at Factorial!

To wrap up:

We're looking for a mid-level Data Analyst Engineer.

The compensation is split: 38,250‚Ç¨ base + 4,250‚Ç¨ variable paid monthly, depending on the company‚Äôs goals.+ ESOP, regardless of your location

You will also benefit from a 1.000‚Ç¨ yearly Learning and Development budget for books, conferences or workshops that will help you grow.

We bring you a safe and diverse environment to grow and make an impact.

If you‚Äôre out of Spain, you will be employed via SafeGuard Global.

Is this you?! Come rock the world with us! üöÄ We #betonpeople üíú

If you don't match everything in this description, we still want to hear from you! There is space to grow in this role, as long as you're curious and eager to learn.

About Factorial HR ü§ì

We just raised a $ 120M Series C to keep providing organisations around the globe with the best tools, information and knowledge to help their people succeed.

Factorial is an all-in-one HR Software fast-growing startup founded 6 years ago. Our mission is to help small and medium companies automate HR workflows, centralise people data and make better business decisions. We Currently serve thousands of customers in over 60 countries all over the world and across industries, and have built a diverse and multicultural team of over +800 people in Barcelona, Brazil, Mexico and EEUU offices as well as remotely.

job description:
About the job
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

We are hiring freelance English and Spanish speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in English and Spanish
You must be living in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Spain
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?
Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative
Remote work & Location Independence
Be your own boss
Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle
Be a part of an online community

job description:
About the job
To empower our Funnels Performance Team, we are looking for a talented Digital Analyst to help the company with all their digital strategies.

We are WIRIS, a software development company founded 20 years ago and headquartered in Barcelona with offices in the USA, and Long Beach (California) since we acquired Design Science company in 2017. Over the past few years, we‚Äôve been named ‚ÄúThe Makers of MathType‚Äù, and our mission is to make people's STEM work more meaningful by creating software with deep knowledge of advanced technology and science.

We are currently more than 80 people revolutionizing the educational field with innovative products that are continuously growing, enhancing our value proposition for our global customers such as NASA, Blackboard, Moodle, Yale University, and Pearson among others.

To find out more about our culture and values, you can take a look at our Instagram account: @lifeatwiris

Key responsibilities

Lead our digital measurement strategy and marketing funnel definition for all products to track their performance, user behavior and improve the conversion rate.
Be responsible for digital products tag implementations through Google Tag Manager.
Set Google Analytics 4 configuration in order to get the best insights from the collected data.
Work with other teams to make sure the digital strategy meets all the business requirements (product, paid ads, store‚Ä¶).
Track funnel KPIs using Google Analytics 4, Salesforce, and other visualization tools to support decision-making. You will have to turn company data into actionable business analysis and meaningful insights.
Analysis and evaluation of promotions, providing results and conclusions to main stakeholders.
Monitor that all tools are working properly and solve any incidents that may arise to ensure the maintenance of the measurement structure.
Participate in the definition and monitoring of digital business objectives, by acquiring a global vision of the company's challenges.
Identify, propose, and implement new measurement strategies or tools that can provide value to our current digital strategy.

Requirements

A data-driven mindset with a focus on real-time performance optimization.
1-2 years of experience in web analytics or product analytics.
Advanced knowledge of Google Analytics 3 or 4 and its implementation.
Advanced knowledge of Google Tag Manager configuration.
Experience in implementing a full digital measurement strategy, including session data, events, and enhanced e-commerce.
Understanding of the marketing funnel optimization and how online marketing works (KPIs, different channels‚Ä¶).
Fluent in Spanish and English.
Ability to organize and crunch data, interpret metrics and identify insights and trends.

We offer

Full-time permanent position.
Competitive salary + optional flex salary plan.
Flexible working hours and a hybrid work environment.
Private health insurance.
Birthday day off, in addition to your vacation days off
Unlimited access to Udemy Business.
In-house English and Spanish lessons to improve your knowledge.
A great work environment in Barcelona city center.
All the coffee you can drink, fresh fruit, and yogurt.

If you consider your profile matches our requirements, this is your moment! Apply now and join us in this new challenge!

Our culture is the result of our behaviors, our personal commitment, our curiosity, how we collaborate, and the ways that we courageously share our perspectives and encourage others to do the same.

job description:
About the job
Beam Suntory is Crafting the Spirits that Stir the World. Rooted in two centuries of family heritage, Beam Suntory has evolved into the world's third largest leading premium spirits company ... where each employee is treated like family and trusted with legacy. With our greatest assets - our premium spirits and our people - we're driving growth through impactful marketing, innovation and an entrepreneurial spirit. Beam Suntory is a place where you can come Unleash your Spirit by making an impact each and every day.

Digital Analyst eCommerce

The following position is open in Madrid, Spain.

What makes this a great opportunity?

Beam Suntory recently entered an amazing race, sailing bravely through the exciting waves of the digital ocean. In typical Beam Suntory fashion, we just "go for it", Yatte Minahare! We're entrepreneurial, agile, dynamic and friendly, and love having fun on and off the job! The role is a fantastic opportunity to have a tangible impact, building the digital analytics capability within the regional eCommerce and Direct-to-Consumer (D2C) business unit (eMU). As well as gain experience in the exciting spirits industry and fast-paced Digital Commerce channel. All in all, a fantastic "learn, apply and deliver" opportunity for any ambitious self-starter.

Role Responsibilities

Develop the digital analytics capability within the eCommerce and D2C business unit (eMU), to support the delivery of 2023 targets and enable Beam Suntory‚Äôs growth ambition
Work closely with the D2C team to build full-funnel analytics capabilities. Set the benchmark for 360 digital analyses on marketing activations (owned, earned and paid channels), and identify new opportunities for growth through CLV and CAC optimization
Collaborate with core eMU functions, and Local Marketing, Media and Commercial teams to enable and optimize our funnels, programs, marketing channels, and campaigns through marketing analytics-informed insights
Be the ambassador of Growth Marketing within the organization, driving internal education, establishing the mindset (data and experimentation), and embedding the corresponding frameworks (process and funnel wise)
Lead Success & Knowledge sharing (learning platform), standardizing frameworks for measurement, best practices and how-to-guides across eSearch, eContent and eShopper, ensuring learnings are translated into relevant business recommendations
Support Annual Planning (1y) and Growth Planning (3y) process, regarding marketing spend and contribution based on analytics of prior performance
Own roadmap of pilots and new tools to test (learning platform) across the eMU marketing team
Collaborate and feedback eData and Global reports to help improve performance measurement and preserve data quality. Proactively input processes that can be improved with better analytics using existing data
Champion performance enhancement projects, such as brand investment (BI) effectiveness and attribution modelling
Guide IT team on systems/tools/martech needed to optimize marketing performance, track customer behavior, or enhance customer experience
Liaise with Global IT, Global Insights, Global Digital Commerce, Global Brand House Digital teams, and Local Markets to ensure the successful development and integration of the digital analytics capability in the organization

Qualifications & Experience

Qualifications and experience:
5+ years proven experience in similar role (digital analytics or growth marketing work)
Knowledge of digital marketing (and its metrics) across website and owned media as well as search (organic and paid), social, display, and programmatic platforms
Knowledge of web analytics (social and search, paid and organic), CRO, experiment design and full funnel marketing
Superior Analytical skills, data-driven mindset, and process oriented
Ability to structure business problems into data analytics plans, and analytics output into actionable insight and business strategies
Test & learn experience, piloting projects and sharing best practices
Think big and have a growth mindset and love to turn data into insight
Learning agility, curiosity and always up to date (trends, tools, techniques, etc)
Ability to operate simultaneously and effectively in both tactical and strategic modes
Professional proficiency in English
Capable of building effective and collaborative work relationships
Excellent communicator, can explain complex problems simply
Able to manage multiple projects, highly organized and detail-oriented
Willingness to lead, own and roll up sleeves to get things done
Self-starter with an ability to deal with ambiguity in a new role
Software requirements:
Google Analytics certification (GA4 preferred)
Knowledge Semrush, Similar Web, and Supermetrics
Data visualization/reporting tools such as PowerBi, Google Data Studio
Experience working with a CDP and email marketing tool (SFMC)


Preferred Qualifications:

(Traditional) Marketing background would be an asset
P&L understanding and (traditional) business KPIs (market share)
Experience working in a start-up where you had to define best practices
Experience in marketing research and statistical analysis
Experience in the alcoholic beverages industry a plus
Software engineering, automation, machine learning knowledge valuable

At Beam Suntory, people are our number one priority, and we believe our people grow together in diverse and inclusive environments where their unique insights, experiences and backgrounds are valued and respected. Beam Suntory is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, military veteran status and all other characteristics, attributes or choices protected by law. All recruitment and hiring decisions are based on an applicant‚Äôs skills and experience.

position: Register your interest for a Statistician role
job description:
About the job
Location: Macclesfield (UK), Gaithersburg (US), Gothenburg (Sweden) Barcelona (Spain) or Warsaw (Poland)

Competitive salary and benefits

Are you a Statistician ‚Äì experienced or in the beginning of your career? Do you have an appetite to use statistical methods to develop life-changing medicines? If you would like to apply your expertise in a global company pushing the boundaries of science ‚Äì join us!

AstraZeneca is a global, science-led, patient-focused biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development and commercialisation of prescription medicines for some of the world‚Äôs most serious disease. But we‚Äôre more than one of the world‚Äôs leading pharmaceutical companies.

We work on some of the most complex and interesting challenges. A fast-paced and agile team, we are empowered and trusted to innovate and experiment. With access to our extensive capabilities and comprehensive pipeline, you‚Äôll be involved in countless submissions and a wide range of engaging projects along the complete drug development process.

We are offering opportunities for Statisticians and Statistical Leaders at several different career levels, depending on your previous experience. You will join a global, diverse and cross-functional environment where you will get personal and professional development.

In this role, we will give you the chance to utilise your statistical expertise in the design, analysis, and interpretation of clinical trial programs; submission and defence of regulatory filings; and the generation of evidence to support product commercialisation and reimbursement.

Main Duties And Responsibilities

You will use your statistical know-how to contribute to the design and progress of clinical trial programs. You may already be equipped to lead statistical employees, either by technical leadership or line management. We offer a role suited perfectly for your competence.

Your responsibilities will include:

Contribute to or lead the statistical thinking, analysis and reporting to relevant groups in product and study teams
Develop design options and provide high-quality information for the business through partnership with internal and external experts
Representing AstraZeneca to Health Authorities and Reimbursement & Payer Organisations for specific projects
Apply expert skills to investigate and use standard, as well as novel, statistical approaches for relevant statistical issues

Essential Requirements

We are looking for an individual who can focus on solving challenging problems through teamwork and partnerships. You are a specialist, or seek to be a specialist in your field, and you know that the best results are achieved by utilising the strengths of every individual.

You have a Master‚Äôs or Doctorate degree in Statistics, Biostatistics, Mathematics or similar area
You possess excellent interpersonal skills, especially when communicating statistical concepts to non-statisticians

Why AstraZeneca?

At AstraZeneca we‚Äôre dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and unleash your entrepreneurial spirit. There‚Äôs no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and always committed to lifelong learning, growth and development. We‚Äôre on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare.

So, what‚Äôs next?

Are you already imagining yourself joining our team? Good, because we can‚Äôt wait to hear from you.
Are you ready to bring new ideas and fresh thinking to the table? Brilliant! We have one seat available and we hope it‚Äôs yours.

Where can I find out more?

Our Social Media, Follow AstraZeneca on LinkedIn https://www.linkedin.com/company/1603/
Follow AstraZeneca on Facebook https://www.facebook.com/astrazenecacareers/
Follow AstraZeneca on Instagram https://www.instagram.com/astrazeneca_careers/?hl=en
Please visit our dedicated Biometrics webpage https://careers.astrazeneca.com/biometrics

About the job
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone!

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Scientist into our Analytics team, where you will work to understand our gamers‚Äô behavior, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you‚Äôll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint . To truly make an impact you‚Äôll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?
Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions.
Turn our vast amount of data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on data exploration, modeling and analysis.
Propose, design and implement new data models (prediction, estimation, forecasting) to exploit opportunities and improve the performance of our games.
Visualize and communicate the results of your data analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Coding algorithms that can be embedded in our ongoing data processes, working closely with data engineers and scientists.
Debugging and problem-solving to ensure the quality and accuracy of your findings and metrics.
Team up with other game data scientists to lead projects on machine learning.
Requirements
2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value
A Masters degree in a quantitative field, including hard sciences (e.g Physics, Stats, Maths, Engineering) & social sciences (Economics, Psychology, Sociology‚Ä¶)
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python or R for data exploratory analysis.
Creating dashboards and visualising findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
Passion for games, or high interest in the mobile gaming industry
Curiosity about everything & ability to innovate & work independently
Nice-to-haves
Experience in a mobile B2C business .
Experience implementing data science models with Python or R .
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
Experience designing and analysing randomized experiments
A fast learner, highly meticulous , a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.
What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?
Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have employed a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you‚Äôre not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.
A very generous ticket-restaurant to restore some life-points.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop‚Ä¶Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!
Coming to work in the office? Don‚Äôt worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:
Want to stay in shape? We have state of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now! Please click ‚Äúapply‚Äù to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You‚Äôre welcome on the team no matter where you‚Äôre from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It‚Äôs a trick question ‚Äì mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

position: IT Business Analyst for Human Resources
job description:
About the job
The Position

IT Business Analyst

Purpose:

As a Business Analyst, you will work closely with People & Culture and Informatics stakeholders and with stakeholders punctually with stakeholders from other Business Units. Your goal is to understand and anticipate business needs within a project or product team context. You understand the strategic business- and IT drivers and will act as a change agent to plan and implement technology change initiatives across the organization in accordance with identified business needs integrated with the necessary reliability, usability and scalability.

The Role

Provide expertise by identifying, evaluating, designing and deploying systems and processes that are lean thus cost effective and align with user requirements and technology roadmaps
Business requirement analysis, business case development, and the ability to make recommendations to improve the experience on technology products
Proven expertise in business process and/or data modeling, by analyzing, defining and documenting detailed process workflows through user interviews, facilitated workshops and expert engagement
Working with business users of new and/or changed products to modify their processes and/or ways of working to derive the economic benefits
Develop and maintain effective working relationships with all levels of management and stakeholders in Business and IT
Ensure all applications supporting the business are compliant with internal Roche security, risk management policies and practices, external regulatory and statutory requirements
Facilitate and validate system and user acceptance testing


Who You Are

Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Computer Science or HR oriented Degree
3-5 years experience as Business Analyst,HR domain background is preferred
Extensive IT Project and Agile Methodolgies Experience in mid and large scale projects and products
Familiar with the concepts, standards, technology, tools, processes, procedures, software and services in use for delivering information services
Strong influencing, communication and team-working skills at all levels as well as negotiation skills and proven track record in getting mutual decisions and sign-offs
Technically and economomical oriented analytical mindset paired with problem-solving skills, along with experience of applying industry standard business analysis methods
Must be able to work with minimal supervision. Ability to plan own work to meet objectives, and to work independently

At Roche, we believe in diversity and inclusion as essential values for our success. We have special interest in integrating people with disabilities into our teams. If you have a disability, for us it is a plus, and we have special benefits for you: Go ahead and present your candidacy!

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we‚Äôve become one of the world‚Äôs leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

job description:
About the job
Application Deadline: 3 July 2023

Department: Data Science

Employment Type: Full Time

Location: Barcelona, ES

Reporting To: Mengxi Li

Description

Tripledot Studios are looking for a Data Scientist to join the Data Science team in either our London or Barcelona office. Successful candidates will partner closely with product and marketing to use their expertise to make our games and business even better. We currently capture 10,000+ data points per second (and growing fast!) so this is a great opportunity for the right candidate to join a fast-growing company and make an impact on our games that are played by millions of players every day. You'll be working alongside a team of enthusiastic Data Scientists coming from a variety of backgrounds (including ex- King, Google, start-ups and Big4 consultancy) with a best-in-class tech stack including Snowflake, Airflow, AWS ECS, ECR, SageMaker, and MLFlow.

Key Responsibilities

Partner with Product and Marketing teams to discover and deliver projects that use data, statistics and machine learning. Deliver insights to drive business decisions and design algorithms that can be used in our games and systems to improve their functionality.
Work with data engineers to ensure proper dimensions and metrics are incorporated into our pipelines. Develop an excellent understanding of relevant internal and external data sources.
Work together with other data scientists to develop and promote best practices in analytics and experimentation across the company. Work with data engineering and developers to design and build internal self-service analytics and experimentation tooling.

Skills, Knowledge & Expertise

A Bachelor's degree in a quantitative subject or equivalent experience.
Experience articulating product questions, identifying and querying data (SQL) and using statistics to arrive at an answer.
A sound understanding of statistics (probability distributions, sampling, hypothesis testing, regression) and experience in applying some of these concepts in real-life problems.
Experience using statistical software and programming using R, SQL, python or similar in datasets.
Excellent communication skills to understand business needs of cross-functional stakeholders, deliver findings and recommendations, as well as to drive collaboration.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience in identifying opportunities for product or business improvements and measuring the success of those initiatives.
Good organisation and attention to detail - demonstrated by e.g. experience in maintaining and organising documentation, metadata and/or working to coding style guides.
Experience in designing, building and maintaining dashboards using software such as Looker, Qlik or Tableau.
Experience in applying modelling techniques e.g. time series forecasting, segmentation / clustering, anomaly detection.

Benefits

Competitive Salary
Yearly CPD allowance for learning and development materials, courses and seminars
Health insurance, Dental, Life, and Critical Illness cover
Subsidised gym membership and cycle to work scheme
Exciting perks and team events

job description:
About the job
Description

Clarity AI‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.
We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are looking for an Associate - Data Research that will help us build a reliable and scalable database of sustainability information, through research on public companies‚Äô ESG indicators and quality assurance. The role provides an opportunity to understand the reporting standards that exist and how companies‚Äô sustainability performance is measured.

LOCATION:
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Working as an Associate - Data Research you will be responsible for ensuring that we have the most accurate environmental, social and governance data in order to provide the most reliable sustainability impact measurements. The Associate - Data Research role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:
Assist in data collection project management through data analysis, quality assurance and data monitoring using BI, Excel, SQL and Python
Conduct frequent research on ESG reporting standards and assist in the development of methodologies for the collection of environmental indicators (e.g. CO2 emissions, energy consumption, waste generation)

Perform ad hoc team projects as needed

Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Sustainability, Finance, Economics, International Relations, Accounting, Environmental Studies or similar field of study
2+ years of experience in a related field (company fundamentals analysis, sustainability, data collection, data analysis, data research, consulting, auditing)
Basic knowledge of Python and/or SQL
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, and BI tools (e.g. Quicksight, Tableau)
Prior/working knowledge of ESG research or analysis is an advantage
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail and ability to work with complex datasets
Highly motivated, independent, proactive and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact

*Only CVs in English will be taken into account

TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Flexible Hours to fit in with your lifestyle

job description:
About the job
Overview
The role will include managing ad-hoc reporting tasks for production, sales, client reporting and more functions in the company. Ownership of monthly products, maintaining and developing those products to the satisfaction of the stakeholders.
Description
Design & implement reports, dashboards and visualizations using data visualization business intelligence tools
Maintain documentation for design, development and reporting work
Optimize reporting dashboards with a focus on usability, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization
Owning big projects and products that require monthly maintenance and development.
Working closely with stakeholders and leaders to develop tools to drive efficiency and improvement in production and sales processes
Gather member experience data and conduct analysis to identify gaps, opportunities and performance trends both internally and externally.
Required Skills
At least 2-3 year of experience using Tableau or similar self-service BI product
Experience in creating interactive dashboards with actions, parameter controls, and filters
Experience in analytics and reporting lifecycle
Background in preparing data for analysis, KPI definition, and reporting
Proven analytical and quantitative skills and an ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions, develop business cases, and complete root cause analyses
Ability to work effectively as an individual and part of a team, meet tight deadlines and prioritize workloads in a fast paced environment
Strategic thinker with the ability to see/understand the big picture, develop new ideas and think through creative solutions
Excellent communication skills (both written and verbal) in English
Attention to detail
Ability to learn new skills quickly
Exceptional problem solving/critical thinking skills
Ability to maintain professionalism, focus and result-orientation under pressure and tight deadlines
Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent
Desired Skills
Prior translation industry experience
Knowledge of SQL
Knowledge of coding language (Python, R, Java)
