job description:
About the job
The Position

Mission

As a Business Analyst (BA) you will oversee and perform analytical and conceptual activities to one or many accounted business domain(s) against internal business partners.

What you‚Äôll be working on

Is an active part in the product‚Äôs lifecycle management and ensures that any solution is chosen to fulfill known and understood business requirements, fitting into the Product roadmap definitions and continuously providing business value over its lifecycle
Often assumes the additional role of IT Business Partner, Product Manager, Squad Lead where appropriate
Develops and maintains the business case including high level solution options and resource estimates and resource confirmation as in support to the strategic backlog management process
Acts as an interface between business and IT functions and as a contact point for business leads in order to launch initiatives, leading and driving the scoping phase
Collaborates with IT Business Partner and/or Product Manager in business development activities like translating business strategy in technology enabled strategies, C-POD activities, portfolio management processes, feasibility studies, clarifying available technology on the market and vendor selection (RFI/RFP/RFQ)
Strives for harmonization of business processes across sites and departments by propagating common standardized data models, applications and technologies that are in line with the cross-functional or functional Informatics strategies and architectures
Performs typical Business Analysis activities and creates deliverables as per Roche standards within a squad/project like a Business Case, Project Charter and URS/User Stories
Works with delivery and the project team to ensure that the final solution matches the URS and customer‚Äôs needs and is delivered according to plan

The ideal candidate
Has business domain knowledge for the following area(s) International market, international commercial, and affiliates environment
Has the typical skills expected from a Business Analyst, i.e.: business partnering, ability to quickly learn new business domains, requirements elicitation and management, business process analysis and design, usability and the ability to facilitate workshops
Has an Agile mindset in the approach to work, i.e.:
Enables a diverse group of partners to speak with a single voice
Ensures the right information is available to the development team in the right level of detail at the right time so that the product can be developed and matches customers needs
Exhibits intellectual curiosity and integrity and has a strong passion to bring value-adding technology to the business.
Exhibits strong soft skills typically required as a BA (i.e.: active listening, challenging the status quo

At Roche, we believe in diversity and inclusion as essential values for our success. We have special interest in integrating people with disabilities into our teams. If you have a disability, for us it is a plus, and we have special benefits for you: Go ahead and present your candidacy!

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we‚Äôve become one of the world‚Äôs leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

job description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to Know our Team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g. SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently

It‚Äôs Great if you Have:

Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

job description:
About the job
TELUS International AI-Data Solutions partners with a diverse and vibrant community to help our customers enhance their AI and machine learning models. The work of our AI Community contributes to improving technology and the digital experiences of many people around the world. Our AI Community works in our proprietary AI training platform handling all data types (text, images, audio, video and geo) across 500+ languages and dialects. We offer flexible work-from-home opportunities for people with passion for languages. The jobs are part-time, and there is no fixed schedule. Whoever you are, wherever you come from, come join our global AI community. www.telusinternational.com

We are hiring freelance English and Spanish speaking Online Data Analysts for a project aimed at improving the content and quality of digital maps, which are used by millions of users globally. The job would suit someone who is detail-oriented, likes doing research and has a good knowledge of national and local geography.
This is a freelance position on a flexible schedule - you can work in your own time whenever work is available. You will be completing research and evaluation tasks in a web-based environment, eg verifying and comparing data, determining the relevance and accuracy of information. You will be provided with guidelines for each task, which need to be followed. The project offers a variety of tasks, and work is paid per task.

Requirements
Full Professional Proficiency in English and Spanish
You must be living in Spain for the last 2 consecutive years
Ability to follow guidelines and do research online using search engines, online maps and website information
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Spain
Being open to work across a diverse set of Task Types (e.g. News, Audio tasks, Relevance)
Applicants must be 18 years or over.

Working on this project will require you to go through a standard recruitment process (including passing an open book assessment). This is a long-term project and your work will occasionally be subject to quality assurance checks.

Why Join the TELUS International AI Community?
Earn extra income
Access to our community wellbeing initiative

job description:
About the job
Description

Clarity AI‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.
We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are looking for an Associate - Data Research that will help us build a reliable and scalable database of sustainability information, through research on public companies‚Äô ESG indicators and quality assurance. The role provides an opportunity to understand the reporting standards that exist and how companies‚Äô sustainability performance is measured.

LOCATION:
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Working as an Associate - Data Research you will be responsible for ensuring that we have the most accurate environmental, social and governance data in order to provide the most reliable sustainability impact measurements. The Associate - Data Research role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:
Assist in data collection project management through data analysis, quality assurance and data monitoring using BI, Excel, SQL and Python
Conduct frequent research on ESG reporting standards and assist in the development of methodologies for the collection of environmental indicators (e.g. CO2 emissions, energy consumption, waste generation)
Mentor and train external contractors and internal team on environmental indicators and sustainability frameworks
Perform ad hoc team projects as needed


Requirements:
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Sustainability, Finance, Economics, International Relations, Accounting, Environmental Studies or similar field of study
2+ years of experience in a related field (company fundamentals analysis, sustainability, data collection, data analysis, data research, consulting, auditing)
Basic knowledge of Python and/or SQL
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, and BI tools (e.g. Quicksight, Tableau)
Prior/working knowledge of ESG research or analysis is an advantage
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail and ability to work with complex datasets
Highly motivated, independent, proactive and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact

*Only CVs in English will be taken into account

job description:
About the job
About Agoda

Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations, flights, and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings, our 6,000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity, creativity, and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership,‚ÄØenhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.

Get to know our team:

The Performance Marketing Team of Agoda is a world leader in online marketing. This department is highly data-driven and focused on developing at-scale marketing programs that improve the lifetime value of Agoda customers through measurable marketing programs and channels. The team is a blend of the best analysts, marketing strategists, and data scientists in the world. The marketing leadership at Agoda has deep experience in data science, product, strategy, and other marketing fields and has built an organization that thrives on data, creative ideas, and technology. The Performance Marketing Team also fosters a great learning environment. You will be able to learn and grow by working closely with experts from a variety of backgrounds from all over the world.

Due to continued expansion, there are multiple analyst roles within the marketing team across different marketing channels. While the scope will vary depending on these channels, here are some examples:

Experimentation and optimizing campaign performance: Experiment with ads/campaign structures and bidding& pricing strategies on partners such as Google, Bing, TripAdvisor, Trivago, and other search engines. Adapt to new product features and roll out changes from successful tests.
Modeling: Analyze vast amounts of data generated by experiments, develop predictive models using data science techniques (e.g. understanding the impact on bookings from large-scale TV campaigns or demand elasticity from pricing optimization), and liaise with product teams on an implementation roadmap
Reporting, analysis, and insights: Building dashboards to track performance, derive insights, understand growth levers, and communicate recommendations via presentations to stakeholders

What you‚Äôll Need to Succeed:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher from top university in a quantitative subject e.g. computer science, mathematics, engineering business, science, or relevant field of study
0 to 4 years experience in data crunching from top-tier consulting, investment banking, private equity or strategy/business role for a fast-growing global tech company
Experience in one or more data analysis packages or databases, e.g., SQL, SAS, R, SPSS, Python, VBA and visualization tools, e.g. Tableau, Power BI, etc.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to move fast and be efficient, making decisions on objective data evidence
Innate desire to take ownership, make an impact and influence outcomes
Excellent organizational skills, attention to detail and ability to work independently

It‚Äôs great if you have:

Experience in digital marketing or e-commerce
Experience with A/B testing and other testing metrics
Strong presentation and negotiation skills

job description:
About the job
Job Reference ID:

230001FB

Responsibilities

Societe Generale Securities Services (SGSS) has a Commercial team in Madrid, covering Spain and Portuguese markets. The commercial team consists of a Commercial Director and two Relationship Managers.

The objective of this team is to continue developing the sales activity focus on local players and maintaining an excellent service quality for our non-resident clients. As part of our sales strategy, our goal is provide global custody, cross-border solutions and specific products to extend our services, increase our client¬¥s data & market share, NBI and consolidate and our local presence in Spain

The VIE would have the following tasks:
Perform a detailed Product Market Analysis of the region/product
Review, analyse and document the Broker Dealer Market in the region
Review, analyse and document the Wealth Management & Alternative AM market in the region
Review, analyse and document the Insurance and Pension Fund market in the region
Review, complete and maintain the list of Tier 2 and Tier 3 Asset Management in the Region and their custody providers
Support a detailed Product Gap Analysis based in the Market insights acquired and the existing product capabilities within SGSS
For the Broker Dealer Segment and the Asset Management Segment
Support SGSS Global Sales Facilitation teams in contributing locally to transversal processes: Sales Plan, mid-year Review, Prospecting Universe definition, deals and meetings follow-up, etc.

Profile Required

PLEASE NOTE that since this program is primarily an international development program, candidates cannot apply to a VIE assignment in their own country of citizenship.

To facilitate the examination of your application by our English-speaking managers, we thank you for applying in English.

Graduate with a Master degree from Business/Engineering School or University with a specialization in Financial Markets
A previous experience in Securities servicing or business analyst in a financial environment (banking industry) could be appreciated
Analytical skills
Proficient in MS Office,
Fluent in Spanish, French and English

The VIE assignment in a nutshell

This VIE in Madrid is to begin as soon as possible but you need to plan 3 months between your application date and the beginning of your VIE assignment. It will last 12 months.

The VIE is a specific contract, under Business France‚Äôs eligibility criteria, opened to candidates under 28 and from the member states of the European Economic Space. For further information (including your financial indemnities), please see Mon VIE-VIA Business France.

We would like to draw your attention to the fact there that your VIE mission could potentially get postponed, depending on the evolution of the health crisis and subjects to the decision made by the Crisis and Support Centre of the Ministry of Europe and Foreign Affairs (MEAE). In addition, the selected candidate will only be paid upon confirmation from Business France and arrival in the country of assignment.

Why join us

As soon as you arrive, you will be integrated into our teams and will learn every day alongside our experts, who will support you in your tasks. Gradually, you will become more independent in your projects, making this experience a real career accelerator. You will also discover all the diversity of our businesses, in a sector that is constantly evolving and innovating.

At the end of your VIE, various opportunities could be offered to you, in France and abroad.

Business insight

At Societe Generale, we are convinced that people are drivers of change, and that the world of tomorrow will be shaped by all their initiatives, from the smallest to the most ambitious.

Whether you‚Äôre joining us for a period of months, years or your entire career, together we can have a positive impact on the future. Creating, daring, innovating and taking action are part of our DNA.

If you too want to be directly involved, grow in a stimulating and caring environment, feel useful on a daily basis and develop or strengthen your expertise, you will feel right at home with us!

Still hesitating?

You should know that our employees can dedicate several days per year to solidarity actions during their working hours, including sponsoring people struggling with their orientation or professional integration, participating in the financial education of young apprentices, and sharing their skills with charities. There are many ways to get involved.

We are an equal opportunities employer and we are proud to make diversity a strength for our company. Societe Generale is committed to recognizing and promoting all talents, regardless of their beliefs, age, disability, parental status, ethnic origin, nationality, gender identity, sexual orientation, membership of a political, religious, trade union or minority organisation, or any other characteristic that could be subject to discrimination.

job description:
About the job
Ready for your next adventure?

We are Socialpoint, a world-renowned mobile games studio based in sunny Barcelona. Our games are positioned in the top rankings of both iOS and Android, and they are played and loved by millions of fans all over the world. We are proud members of the Take-Two Interactive and Zynga family, and we are on a mission to offer a great gaming experience and bring fun to everyone!

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Scientist into our Analytics team, where you will work to understand our gamers‚Äô behavior, and work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, data science, statistics & programming, you‚Äôll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint . To truly make an impact you‚Äôll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with analytics & game teams.

What will you do in Socialpoint?
Work with the game development teams to provide insights into user behavior and answer key business questions.
Turn our vast amount of data into actionable insights, by performing hands-on data exploration, modeling and analysis.
Propose, design and implement new data models (prediction, estimation, forecasting) to exploit opportunities and improve the performance of our games.
Visualize and communicate the results of your data analysis to senior stakeholders, making data driven recommendations that support key decisions.
Coding algorithms that can be embedded in our ongoing data processes, working closely with data engineers and scientists.
Debugging and problem-solving to ensure the quality and accuracy of your findings and metrics.
Team up with other game data scientists to lead projects on machine learning.
Requirements
2-3 years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value
A Masters degree in a quantitative field, including hard sciences (e.g Physics, Stats, Maths, Engineering) & social sciences (Economics, Psychology, Sociology‚Ä¶)
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Highly proficient in SQL as well as Python or R for data exploratory analysis.
Creating dashboards and visualising findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau or Looker.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
Passion for games, or high interest in the mobile gaming industry
Curiosity about everything & ability to innovate & work independently
Nice-to-haves
Experience in a mobile B2C business .
Experience implementing data science models with Python or R .
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
Experience designing and analysing randomized experiments
A fast learner, highly meticulous , a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win.
What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?
Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have employed a hybrid working from home/office system. So, what does this mean? All we ask is that you live within commuting distance of our office in Barcelona so you are able to come into the office for important meetings/events.
Relocation support to help you move to Barcelona (if you‚Äôre not already here).
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays.
A very generous ticket-restaurant to restore some life-points.
Private medical insurance for you and your family, to keep your health bar full.
Choose from the latest IOS or Android device upon joining (phone or tablet).
Free language lessons (English & Spanish ).
Spotify Premium to add that special soundtrack that every adventure deserves.
Legendary social events & parties to let off some steam.
Players develop‚Ä¶Oops, sorry! People development is key for us: an amazing budget just for you to spend skilling up your abilities & knowledge to achieve real growth opportunities!
Coming to work in the office? Don‚Äôt worry - we have you covered. Check out some of our onsite benefits:
Want to stay in shape? We have state of the art gym facilities so you can level up your build stats.
A massive gaming room equipped with all consoles and games you could ask for.
Book an appointment with our onsite physiotherapist for your aches and pains.
Drop by our onsite hairdressers for a trim (and forget your wallet; it's a Guild perk).
The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now! Please click ‚Äúapply‚Äù to level up and submit your application in English.

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You‚Äôre welcome on the team no matter where you‚Äôre from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It‚Äôs a trick question ‚Äì mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

job description:
About the job
At the SEAT:CODE we are constantly looking for talented people willing to join our projects. Our start-up environment is very open minded, we love to test and implement new ideas. If you think you are ready to enjoy your work and be part of our big family, we invite you to keep reading what we think it could be a good fit for our current needs üòä.

The Data Scientist role ü§î

Develop solutions using a range of data science techniques
Implement and understand a range of data science techniques and be able to develop models including machine learning
Collaborate with the team to develop data science solutions according to business needs
Perform analytics on data
Able to recognise and exploit business opportunities to ensure more efficient and effective performance of organisations
Develop data science solutions that are fit for purpose, resilient, scalable and future-proof, to meet user needs
Help team to achieve their goals and be aligned to business needs.
About the Team ü§ó

Our technical Team loves to deliver really well-crafted solutions at decent speed. We love tech so we really give great attention to the technology (Technology as first class Citizen)
We know that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things.
We like to measure everything, so we are always improving, for that we use the best tools on the market such as Datadog.
Finally, we promote a culture of no blame, trust, and learning, and we support the mantra ‚Äúif it hurts do it more often‚Äù so good CI and CD are really key for us.
What we offer ü§©

Possibility to work remotely within Spain (you can work from any city of Spain üòé)
2.000‚Ç¨ per year in social benefits to choose from: restaurant, kindergarten, health Insurance, private insurance, fuel, transportation, gym pass, cleaning services, WIFI, Holaluz contract, etc.

job description:
About the job
OW a controlled 50/50 joint venture between EDP and Engie is looking for a proactive and analytical "Market Intelligence Analyst".

Are you willing to join a passionate and high performing team, in a cross-cultural, fast-paced, and strongly grOWing environment?

GENERAL DESCRIPTION

Corporate EPCI is enhancing its Market Intelligence skills, centralizing the information available in the market, and putting it at disposal of the whole company. Apart from creating, updating, and managing the databases, the team is developing in house Market Intelligence tools and providing different teams with periodic reports.

MAIN ACCOUNTABILITIES

As Market Intelligence Analyst you will:
Build, update and maintain the OW Market Intelligence Database including information both from public data sources and internal knowledge.
Develop and maintain visual in-house Market Intelligence tools and dashboards to translate data contained in the OW Market Intelligence Database into executable insights.
Build and automatize the creation of regular reports and studios to periodically share with different stakeholders across the organization.

ACADEMIC BACKGROUND

University Degree Level.

LANGUAGES

OW has an international team of employees and the working language is English.

REQUIREMENTS

Advanced Excel based modelling (Visual Basics) and Power BI knowledge are essential.
Experience in creating data bases and modelling in Excel, SQL, Power BI, or more sophisticated architectures.
Experience with coding and statistical software as SQL, R or Python.

OTHER SKILLS

Competence with Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Analytical and critical thinking.
High standards of organisational skills, ability to prioritise workload, able to work under pressure.
Positive & proactive attitude with self-motivated outlook.
Able to work with different teams, sometimes situated in other offices or countries.

OTHER REQUIREMENTS

Job location will be Madrid.

job description:
About the job
Project Manager / Business Analyst
Location ‚Äì Madrid, Spain
Remote Working Opportunities Available.


Who are we?
Assurant, Inc. is a global leader in business services for the connected world. Our lifestyle and housing solutions help leading brands grow revenue, manage risk and provide a great experience for their customers. We support, connect and service over 300 million consumers worldwide, helping people get more value from their connected devices, vehicles and homes. Assurant is a proud member of the Fortune 500, with decades of experience in the industries we serve.


Our Values:
Common Sense, Common Decency, Uncommon Thinking and Uncommon Results guide our every action at Assurant. These values inspire our commitment to be a responsible corporate citizen.


The Opportunity:
Reporting to the Implementation Director Europe, this is an exciting opportunity to join the EU Implementation team and support Assurant Europe in driving improvement change across our business from idea stage to delivery. You will pro-actively communicate and collaborate with the primary Assurant business solutions, project and operational stakeholders to initially define and detail - supporting or leading - the production of project documentation such as Customer Journey‚Äôs, Business Process Maps, UML Sequence Diagrams, Data Flow Diagrams, and different types of Functional Requirements / Use Cases / Features; And ultimately support the Assurant business in delivering value add change across our Southern and Central Europe business units, working with all company partners and our clients to ensure outstanding service which includes supporting the Business Product Owner to achieve non-functional requirements and supporting the Agile scrum teams with implementation tasks including Business Readiness. You will manage and implement different sized programs that span over one or more lines of Business and Agile Scrum Teams. This will include following the appropriate implementation framework for building, and reporting ensuring all important partners are kept informed at an appropriate level, acting as a trusted Project Manager throughout the full project lifecycle.

This role will have a primary focus on Business Change initiatives approved by the appropriate Assurant Board, covering:
On-boarding of new clients
Performance, Process & Regulatory improvements
Improvements within current Client services
Product Development
Facilitating Continuous Improvement in the business



You Will Have:
Higher Education in Business / Economics / IT disciplines
SAFe 5.0 Scaled Agile Framework knowledge
Experience of working within projects/change on Insurance, Finance, Telecom or Supply chain delivery preferable
Good experience of delivering concurrent and often complex software-enabled projects into a pan-European landscape, working with Global Enterprise Resources to achieve success
Fluency in English and Spanish as minimum, with added language skills in Italian and / or German welcome but not essential
Strong, diverse documentation skills, ensuring all requirements captured are clear, concise and appropriate for a cross-functional Business & Technical audience (Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Visio skills highly beneficial)
Ability to communicate complex business requirements in a non-technical and simple way that encourages cross-functional advocacy both internally across the Assurant Solutions Business and externally (Clients/3rd Parties etc)
Strong Project Management skills (MS Project skills are advisable) with proven experience of working within Project/Change in Global/Regional delivery environment
Excellent presentation, communication & stakeholder management skills, including influencing & negotiation skills
Highly organized, with a flexible approach to work, ability to multi-task effectively and excellent attention to detail
Positive and pro-active mindset, with a willingness to continually stretch themselves and develop their skill set and career
Willingness to go above and beyond ‚Äì and inspire their project teams to do the same ‚Äì to deliver high quality, value-adding projects on time, within cost
Must thrive in an open, challenging and supportive environment with a determination to succeed
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment meeting tight deadlines while multitasking


Benefits & Training
Bonus Scheme
Private health care
Life assurance
Mobile phone & laptop
Flexible Working
Internal Wellbeing Programme
LinkedIn Learning
Learning and Development opportunities


At Assurant, diversity helps us inspire creativity in the global marketplace, and we are believers in the strategic value of inclusion and how it improves performance, creates growth opportunities, better aligns us to our clients, and enhances employee engagement.
To view a full list of the responsibilities and requirements, please visit the job description on the European Careers site.

We look forward to receiving your application!

job description:
About the job
About Arup

Arup is an independent company of engineers, architects, designers, consultants, and technical specialists offering a wide range of professional services.

It is the creative force behind some of the most important and innovative projects in today‚Äôs-built environment, both small and large in scale. With 90 offices in 35 countries, our more than 18,000 employees offer a wide range of professional services. Thus, through our work, we want to create a positive impact in our current environment.

We have been present in Spain since 1993 and we have a tea of more than 220 engineers, consultants, and qualified technical personnel. We work for clients from the public and private sectors, providing creative and sustainable solutions based on the efficient use of resources.

The role

We‚Äôre looking for an IT support analyst to be the front-door to technology services to the rest of the organisation. You will help to increase business productivity by taking a customer-focused, proactive and collaborative approach to anticipating and resolving technology issues. You will provide support and technical expertise to a range of issues relating to hardware, software, peripherals and projects.

Working under the guidance of the local service lead, you will be part of a larger team that provides customer-focused digital services to Arup globally. This is a full time, level 2 support role in a typical IT support infrastructure, with a business-focused mindset.

We provide opportunities for all our people to develop their skills, along with challenging and innovative work in an environment that allows individuals to flourish. We believe in continuous learning; providing a culture that is naturally curious and always stimulating. One that promotes self-discovery and allows people time to be creative.

‚Äú I enjoy the variety of my role - no two days are the same. One day I might be reassuring a nervous presenter minutes before they present to hundreds of colleagues via a live stream. The next day I might be trying to fix a laptop remotely with a colleague who has a looming deadline or showing them how to get the most out of the latest digital tools .‚Äù Caitlin, Brisbane.

Responsibilities Of The Role Include

Acting as client liaison for all Digital Technology-related requests from staff, being first line of engagement to understand and address issues and needs around desktop (Windows, O365 etc.) and infrastructure (compute, storage, network, cloud services, enterprise systems, cybersecurity, etc.), engaging and escalating to other Digital Technology teams as‚ÄØneeded
Providing value added services to the business, working together with the leadership team to drive technology and help transform business‚ÄØactivities
Configuring, deploying, maintaining, troubleshooting and supporting workstations, laptops, printers, mobile devices, phones and other computer and telecoms‚ÄØequipment
Solving problems associated with hardware (PCs, Macs, mobile, etc.), software, and services (video conferencing, remote access, etc.) determining the source of problems and classifying their level, priority and nature. When appropriate, escalating or routing them to‚ÄØthe‚ÄØappropriate‚ÄØteam
Helping with a range of office-based technology needs ‚Äì installations, moves, changes, etc. that involve staff requirements and infrastructure needs, working collaboratively with other DT service‚ÄØteams
Responding to, documenting and resolving service tickets in a timely manner according to an agreed service‚ÄØlevel
Documenting procedures, standards, best practices configurations, settings, installation sequences and back-out instructions
Following ITIL/Service Management policies and procedures
Helping the software asset management team to maintain applications (license management and version control)
Helping with communications and training around technical change
Playing an active part in our team: helping to build an inclusive environment, sharing your knowledge and promoting best technology practices with colleagues

Some of the technology you could expect to support includes:

Personal computing (HP, Mac, etc.)
Mobile computing (iPhone, iPad, Samsung etc. depending on office or regional policy)
Microsoft Windows Operating System, Mac‚ÄØOSx‚ÄØ(limited)
Microsoft 365 and associated services (i.e.‚ÄØOneDrive for Business,‚ÄØMS Teams, etc.)
Cloud based solutions (Azure, AWS, etc.)
Video conferencing hardware/software based on global‚ÄØstandards
Office printers and copiers (these vary depending on office or regional policy)

Please don‚Äôt be discouraged if you don‚Äôt meet every point below ‚Äì if you‚ÄØmeet most, and are strongly motivated by the role, and willing to learn, we are still interested in hearing from you.

Minimum Requirements

Some (1 to 2 years‚Äô) experience working in a regional or global organisation providing desktop support services in a Microsoft environment
A desire to learn, you should have a track record‚ÄØof‚ÄØdeveloping your‚ÄØtechnical knowledge and applying‚ÄØnew skills in a high paced environment
Good analytical skills, with ability to solve problems and openness in sharing your knowledge and thinking with others
Experience of ServiceNow or similar IT Service Management systems
Some experience working in a professional services organisation

Assessable Requirements

Familiarity with MS Teams and O365
Familiarity with technical software solutions from Autodesk, Bentley, Trimble, etc
Familiarity with software solutions from Adobe, Bluebeam, Cisco, Symantec, etc

Conditions

Immediate incorporation

How to apply for this vacancy?

To apply for this vacancy, register your updated CV and a cover letter in English.

Why work at Arup?

We work on innovative and international projects collaborating with different disciplines and offices around the world
We offer flexible check-in and check-out hours and a hybrid work model
You will have the possibility of living a professional experience abroad, through our international assignments
We have continuous training through our Arup University platform, LinkedIn Learning licenses and access to virtual English/Spanish classes
We are committed to equal opportunities through the objectives established in our equality plan
You can participate in groups such as EDI (equality, diversity and inclusion), Community Engagement (commitment to different communities) and Ovagreen (commitment to the environment)
We promote a healthy life among our employees through subsidies with different sports centers, inter-company leagues, tournaments, free daily coffee, tea, local fruit...
We allocate several of our profits to knowledge at work, with the possibility of financing research through the Invest in Arup program
We are committed to a young and dynamic work environment, in which juniors and seniors share values and learn from each other through internal activities
We contribute part of our annual benefits to solidarity projects, such as the design and construction of various buildings and infrastructures in developing countries
The independence of Arup as a company allows us to share with all Arupians a part of the profits obtained globally twice a year
Arup is, according to the ranking of Actualidad Econ√≥mica, El Mundo, one of the best companies to work for in Spain in 2022

What are we searching for?

At Arup we place sustainability at the heart of our projects and invest in research and development to address issues such as climate change and poverty. We have committed to achieving the goal of net zero emissions by 2030 and making a significant contribution to the United Nations Sustainable Development Goals.

Therefore, we look for people who share these concerns and interests, creating shared value for our customers and our communities while safeguarding our planet. Arup commits to net zero across global operations by 2030 - Arup

job description:
About the job
What we are looking for :

Detail-oriented process improvers. Critical thinkers who naturally see opportunities to develop and optimize work processes ‚Äì finding ways to simplify, standardize and automate.

Collaborative partners. People who build and leverage cross-functional relationships to bring together ideas, information, use cases, and industry analyses to develop best practices.

Analytical problem solvers. People who go beyond just fixing to identify root causes, evaluate optimal solutions, and recommend comprehensive upgrades to prevent future issues.

What You Will Do

Prepare and distribute timely and insightful financial analysis with actionable insights and provide recommendations for local business including divisional and enabling functions leadership.
Drive monthly P&L reviews with defined KPIs for all divisions within the region and provide analysis against budget and projection.
Actively interpret and review the results with the business, including trends/issues and opportunities to drive actionable responses.
Guide and support the business to take decisions on well supported financial grounds through business case analysis.
Prepare insightful and dynamic reporting (BI Analytics) for wide range of stakeholders to drive greater insight and visibility into divisional and Enabling Functions financial performance (utilization of Power BI as the main reporting and presentation tool). The regional reports include but are not limited to: sales and gross margin performance, market share and price/volume analysis by customer, expense analysis focusing on marketing and compensation drivers to provide insights for CTG initiatives, among others.
Provide financial analysis and recommendations to ensure business objectives are achieved as they relate to tender negotiations, pricing, or other commercial negotiations.
Actively support structured arrangements and cross divisional deals.
Provide analytical support to Commercial Business to gain a better understanding of market trends, customer trends, and sales channel performance
Perform necessary analysis that aids in the decision-making process and help improve business performance‚Äô
Review P&L and Balance Sheet information and identify errors or exceptions and provide information and insight to ensure correct journals and results. Determination of journal entry amounts for certain revenue and opex categories.
Flash commentary submission to Europe in collaboration with the Business Controller

Budgeting Cycle and Projections:

Plan, collect and consolidate input data for Budget and Projections with well documented assumptions for the P&L and Balance Sheet, including but not limited to: compensation marketing, discretionary, professional services, among others.
Responsible for communicating and reporting of Budget and Projections to the business and enabling functions, when needed.
Support in ensuring forecasting accuracy for the region.
Play an active role in improving Budget and Projection processes.

Other tasks/projects:

Actively participate in projects to further improve finance processes
Identify opportunities for cross divisional collaboration and Flex Finance solutions in the region and work actively with the business to provide the necessary analytical support to aid the deals.
Provide support and insights to the SPI working team and Shrinkage project
Support Assets and Compliance with Capital Placement assessment.
Other: ad hoc projects as assigned by Finance Business Leader and Divisional Finance Director.
Active involvement in business cases to aid decision making and help improve business performance, such as ROI analysis on deals, tender‚Äôs profitability analysis, flex finance options assessment, GPOs agreements or rebates negotiations.
Assist to secure the internal controls for local finance is aligned with corporate policies.
Strong cooperation with local AR team for accruals, rebates, and development of processes.
Support during internal and external audits.

Who You Are

You have a Master Degree in Business and Administration, Finance or other related areas
You have 5+ years of relevant working experience as an Analyst or Accountant preferably within a multinational sales organization
You are fluent in Spanish and English
You have a proven expertise in data analytics, ERP knowledge
You have practical experience of advanced use of excel, financial modelling and data analytics preferrable
Experienced in analyzing data, reporting and month end closing. Preferably within a large complex business.
Process improvement experience (i.e. Lean/Six sigma experience) is an advantage
Demonstrable ability to drive projects that will significantly impact the business
Experience in Medical Device is a plus

Technical skills we are interested in :

Professional certification in controlling (RC/CIMA/CFA) or studying is a plus

Familiar with US GAAP and Sarbanes Oxley

Familiar with a bigger ERP system (such as Oracle or SAP)

Knowledge in Hyperion, Danube, PowerBI is a plus

Advanced Excel skills

What do we offer in return?

We grow talent; we give you the opportunity to develop your career based on your strengths. Stryker is a career destination for engaged, passionate and talented people who are driven to seek the innovation, growth and opportunity that only we offer.

Flat hierarchies and responsibility: through flat hierarchies, we strengthen the initiative and willingness of our employees to take over responsible tasks.
Team spirit & engagement: we create engaged and inclusive teams that encourage colleagues to share their diverse perspectives and opinions.
Recognition of your performance: at our company, outstanding individual and cross-functional team performance is rewarded. Ideas, projects, or other exceptional achievements can be submitted for various awards on a local and global level.

job description:
About the job
The Position

Freelance

Diabetes is a pesky monster ‚Äî and that‚Äôs putting it mildly. If you‚Äôre serious about helping us face it head on, come join us!

For a behind-the-scenes look, check out our Monster Culture blog, this little video and Roche code4life to see what makes mySugr and Roche tick.

Here‚Äôs what we‚Äôre looking for:

We are looking for a Junior Digital Analyst who is self-motivated, really passionate about their/your job, and understands that providing a high-quality service is crucial for the organization. As an ideal team member you are open-minded, curious, dedicated to making a difference and open to constant development. This is a role where you, as a data driven individual, have the opportunity to step up and take on significant responsibility in the Identity and Consent mng.group.You will be joining the Platform ART team to support a metrics design initiative to enable the organization to become more data-driven. The metrics hierarchy developed will serve as a foundation for future analytics projects throughout all related solutions.

Essential skills for your mission:

Knowledge of developing and defining metrics/KPIs
Knowledge of analytical instrumentation
Knowledge of defining standard name conventions (e.g. Data Taxonomy)
Knowledge and /or experience in Analytics Tools like Google Analytics, PowerBI, Heap,HotJar Countly
Experience with working with diverse teams (developers, designers, business stakeholders)
Great skills in reporting- and documentation activities
Ability to build comprehensible reports that can be shared amongst key stakeholders / leadership team
Great written and verbal communication skills in English

Bonus skills:

Digital Analytics certification e.g. Google Data Analytics
Knowledge of the diabetes industry or other comparable health industries

Who we are and what we care about?

Here at Roche Diabetes Care we are committed to providing a healthy, equal and inclusive working environment for our employees to help them make diabetes suck less and bring true relief to the patient! We care about family friendly career paths, sustainability, a healthy lifestyle and the flexibility of a modern workplace. We maintain a culture of learning and sharing, as well as open and candid feedback. At every level, there are many opportunities to develop and grow - both professionally and personally.

Being a global leader in integrated Personalised Diabetes Management (iPDM), Roche Diabetes Care collaborates with pioneers around the globe, including people with diabetes, caregivers, healthcare providers and payers. We aim to transform and advance care provision and foster sustainable care structures. Under the brands RocheDiabetes, Accu-Chek and mySugr, comprising glucose monitoring, insulin delivery systems and digital solutions, we unite with our partners to create patient-centred value. By building and collaborating in an open ecosystem, connecting devices and digital solutions as well as contextualising relevant data points, we enable deeper insights and a better understanding of diabetes, leading to personalised and effective therapy adjustments.

Interested? Great. We‚Äôd like to hear from you! Just click that ‚ÄúApply Now‚Äù button and send us your CV in English‚Ä¶ and anything else that you think might impress us.

Who we are

At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we‚Äôve become one of the world‚Äôs leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.

Roche is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

job description:
About the job
Hi there üëã

As Factorial continues on our mission of boosting the next generation of people-first SMB's, we're hiring a mid level Data Analyst Engineer to help.

The Team and you

Factorial's mission is to empower businesses to make better decisions, and data is a key component in doing so.

You‚Äôll be part of two teams:
the Data team as they are your peers,
The Core domain: you will bring your data engineering & analysis expertise to that product vertical in particular, specialising in those business questions.

Data engineers are responsible of unlocking communication between the different areas despite the technological stack by offering a self-service platform that allows fast data-driven products. We act under the data mesh principle and we're not afraid to build whatever is necessary to fulfil our partner team's needs. Our data platform is already offering the following services:
Ingestion (SaaS APIs, DDBBs, Streams)
Storage (Data Lake, Stream Storage)
Catalogue (Atlan)
Modeling (Metabolic)
Activation (Hightouch)
Exploration & Visualization (Preset)
On-demand Data Products (TinyBird)

We're looking for Data Engineers to enable the product and engineering team to use these and future services, and to assist them in making data a first-class citizen.

The Role

At Factorial, we have a team of +150 very talented developers. We are looking for engineers who can wear many hats, abstract problems, and find creative solutions. We look for smart people who are curious, proactive and have good soft/communication skills.

We are not looking for a long list of skills and technologies. Our web stack is Ruby on Rails for the backend and React/React-native for the clients, and we interact with Data through SQL on AWS, but it's not mandatory to be proficient in those (most of the team came with other areas of expertise which is very enriching). We believe that someone who has good aptitudes and is hungry for learning is what works best.

If you're looking for new challenges in a people-first company no matter where you live, this is what to expect:
You will evangelise the use of our Data Platform among technical users and empower the creation of Factorial's next Data Products.
You will help stakeholders analyse their data: as you grow more comfortable in the business domain, you will be able to ask the right questions as well as craft the queries to answer them.
You will listen, identify and evaluate new requirements from Stakeholders (Engineering, Product, Management, Sales, Customer Experience, Marketing, Growth).
You will occasionally contribute in managing the platform from a DataOps point of view.

Your profile
You are a team player: You are comfortable helping your teammates, sharing your knowledge, reviewing their code and asking for reviews of your own.
You have a user-centric mindset: You know that the only reason we write code is to help the users of Factorial to perform their tasks.
You like relaxed and fun environments: We work hard and we are committed to Factorial users but we do that in a fun and relaxed atmosphere. We don't take ourselves too seriously.
You are a learner: You want to improve your skills not only in the engineering field but across any other areas.
You are an owner: You like proposing new hypotheses and be responsible for building, deploying and validating them.
You love understanding: Breaking down complex problems into basic and shareable elements and you have evolved concrete implementations to abstractions before.
You are a polyglot developer: You have experience in several coding languages, CI/CD tools and cloud technologies.
You are a mentor: You love to share your experience and expertise to help others grow.
You are comfortable communicating in English.

Your background
Experience in building a modern Data Platforms
Functional programming in Scala (or any other JVM language).
Spark development, especially Structured Streaming, or equivalent (Flink, Beam, Samza,...)
Hands-on with Kafka.

Nice-to-haves:
Knowledge of the AWS Analytics Stack (Glue, S3, Athena, Redshift, Kinesis, Lake Formation)
Advanced Analytical SQL knowledge.
Some alternative coding experience, ideally with a background of web development.
Some infrastructure as code experience, ideally with Terraform on Cloud
GitOps driven mentality and data CI/CD ideas.

At Factorial we don't evaluate you by the years of experience you have, we evaluate your knowledge and skills.

How are we doing it? We have a Career Path with a rubric framework where we define what is expected for each experience level and skill we're evaluating. This framework will allow you to know at which level you're right now and what do you need to continue growing in the company.

As we care deeply about transparency (it's one of our hiring values), our Career Path includes the salaries for each level and we share it during the first interview to make sure we're aligned.

We're a remote-first engineering team company so you can apply from anywhere in the world and English is our official language so this is the only one you need to succeed at Factorial!

To wrap up:

We're looking for a mid-level Data Analyst Engineer.

The compensation is split: 38,250‚Ç¨ base + 4,250‚Ç¨ variable paid monthly, depending on the company‚Äôs goals.+ ESOP, regardless of your location

You will also benefit from a 1.000‚Ç¨ yearly Learning and Development budget for books, conferences or workshops that will help you grow.

We bring you a safe and diverse environment to grow and make an impact.

If you‚Äôre out of Spain, you will be employed via SafeGuard Global.

Is this you?! Come rock the world with us! üöÄ We #betonpeople üíú

If you don't match everything in this description, we still want to hear from you! There is space to grow in this role, as long as you're curious and eager to learn.

About Factorial HR ü§ì

We just raised a $ 120M Series C to keep providing organisations around the globe with the best tools, information and knowledge to help their people succeed.

Factorial is an all-in-one HR Software fast-growing startup founded 6 years ago. Our mission is to help small and medium companies automate HR workflows, centralise people data and make better business decisions. We Currently serve thousands of customers in over 60 countries all over the world and across industries, and have built a diverse and multicultural team of over +800 people in Barcelona, Brazil, Mexico and EEUU offices as well as remotely.

job description:
About the job
Being part of LOEWE gives you the opportunity of learning new things every day and working with people passionate about what they do, in a fast moving and ambitious company.

We are looking for a Junior Business Analyst who enjoys a challenge and would like to join our Omnichannel Team based in Madrid and working together with other Business Analysts while the Trading & Operations Manager is on maternity leave.
The main mission of the role will be reporting and analyzing available data to drive sales and enable the e-Merchandising team to take best actions and opportunities for the business.

Your role will be:
Analysing opportunities to uncover actionable insights to maximize sales, focusing on influencing merchandising on regional opportunities
Supporting the Business Analyst in preparing weekly trade reports and streamlining the process through automation
Monitoring warehouses allocations partnering with Supply team and providing input on allocation directions and potential rebalancing between locations to drive down costs
Optimizing internal search engine
What is important for the role:
Previous experience of at least 2 years in analytical positions in a Merchandising or e-Commerce department
Strong analytical, communication and presentation skills
Curious with a positive and can-do attitude; attention to detail
Experience using Google Analytics and PowerBI
Proficiency in MS Office Applications and advanced in Excel
Advanced level of English & Spanish
About us:
Created in Spain in 1846, LOEWE approaches 175 years as one of the world‚Äôs major luxury houses. Since 2013, under LOEWE‚Äôs creative director, Jonathan Anderson, the brand has started a new chapter, presenting itself to the world as a house focused on craft and culture; evidenced through an intellectual yet playful approach to fashion, bold and vibrant Spanish lifestyle, and unmatched expertise with leather.
LOEWE has a rich legacy of craftsmanship dating back to its beginnings as a collective workshop and has long valued artisanal techniques in its approach to design and manufacture. These core values are reflected in the brand‚Äôs belief in the importance of craft in today‚Äôs culture, its modern interpretations of historical artistic achievements and its commitment to supporting contemporary art, craft and culture around the world.



If you think this role is made for you, please send us your CV!

job description:
About the job
üõ´ WHO ARE WE ? üõ´

FCM Travel is one of the largest and fastest-growing global business travel management companies with a worldwide reach in almost 100 countries. FCM Lab in Barcelona represents a tribe of more than 110 teammates, united by a single mission: developing and ensuring the best services and technology products to support business travelers in their trips around the globe.

See our video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xXbK-tag0jk&t=133s) to find out who the Product and Dev in the Barcelona team is. Read more about us at www.fcmtravel.com.

üéØ YOUR MISSIONS

As a member of the Data team at the FCM Lab, you will work with other data analysts to deliver qualitative analysis to our internal and external clients.

Your main tasks will be to produce data reports, data visualisation models and develop new analysis on business travel thematics, using various data visualisation tools (Power BI, Azure & Qlik Sense).

You will work with data from various sources (API, webservices, MySQL & PostGreSQL databases‚Ä¶.), create reports, deploy & manage databases.

You will work with various departments from the company to answer their data needs, both as a data provider and a data consultant.

As a tech savvy, you will juggle with Python & SQL and data visualisation tools. You will discover and develop new innovative tools.
Database architecture & ETL data pipelines (Azure, PowerBI, Python, SQL)
Development & management of databases (PostgresSQL, MySQL)
Fetching data from API (JSON, XML, custom Webservices)
Ideation & development of KPIs and data dashboards (Power BI, Qlik Sense)
Creation & development of KPIs
Creation & automation of Data reports (internal & external clients)
Ticket & project management with various (nice) internal stakeholders

job description:
About the job
Description

Clarity AI‚Äôs mission is to bring social impact to the market. Our disruptive tech tools allow investors, companies, and consumers to invest sustainably, shop sustainably, and report or benchmark for sustainability with easy-to-use, AI-powered technology.
We are a team of 300 highly passionate individuals coming from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading startup backed by investors and strategic partners such as Blackrock and Deutsche Borse who believe in us and share our goals. We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK and the US this year so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading!

We are looking for an Associate - Data Research that will help us build a reliable and scalable database of sustainability information, through research on public companies‚Äô ESG indicators and quality assurance. The role provides an opportunity to understand the reporting standards that exist and how companies‚Äô sustainability performance is measured.

LOCATION:
Madrid or remote

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Working as an Associate - Data Research you will be responsible for ensuring that we have the most accurate environmental, social and governance data in order to provide the most reliable sustainability impact measurements. The Associate - Data Research role will include, but not be limited to, the following activities:
Assist in data collection project management through data analysis, quality assurance and data monitoring using BI, Excel, SQL and Python
Conduct frequent research on ESG reporting standards and assist in the development of methodologies for the collection of environmental indicators (e.g. CO2 emissions, energy consumption, waste generation)
Mentor and train external contractors and internal team on environmental indicators and sustainability frameworks
Perform ad hoc team projects as needed


Requirements:
Excellent oral and written English communication skills (minimum C1 level-proficient user)
At least a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Sustainability, Finance, Economics, International Relations, Accounting, Environmental Studies or similar field of study
2+ years of experience in a related field (company fundamentals analysis, sustainability, data collection, data analysis, data research, consulting, auditing)
Basic knowledge of Python and/or SQL
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of MS Excel, and BI tools (e.g. Quicksight, Tableau)
Prior/working knowledge of ESG research or analysis is an advantage
Strong analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills, with clear attention to detail and ability to work with complex datasets
Highly motivated, independent, proactive and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact

*Only CVs in English will be taken into account

About the job
üõ´ WHO ARE WE ? üõ´

FCM Travel is one of the largest and fastest-growing global business travel management companies with a worldwide reach in almost 100 countries. FCM Lab in Barcelona represents a tribe of more than 110 teammates, united by a single mission: developing and ensuring the best services and technology products to support business travelers in their trips around the globe.

üéØ YOUR MISSIONS

As a member of the Data team at the FCM Lab, you will work with other data analysts to deliver qualitative analysis to our internal and external clients.

Your main tasks will be to produce data reports, data visualisation models and develop new analysis on business travel thematics, using various data visualisation tools (Power BI, Azure & Qlik Sense).

You will work with data from various sources (API, webservices, MySQL & PostGreSQL databases‚Ä¶.), create reports, deploy & manage databases.

You will work with various departments from the company to answer their data needs, both as a data provider and a data consultant.

You are familiar with the Agile methodologies (Scrum)

Good sense of humour compulsory !

üéÅ WHY FCM SPAIN ?

As well as being a fun company to work at, we offer:
Possibility to benefit to a health insurance
25 days off/year* + reduced time during summer + bank holidays
Discounts to access your favorite gym (Andjoy app!)

The opportunity to work with an international and talented team

Salary according to the profile (from 32K‚Ç¨ up to 43K‚Ç¨)

We truly think personality is important so bring it on!

Peroptyx is a provider of data and evaluation solutions used by global technology and financial enterprises to build the most locally relevant, safest and intuitive online services for their customers.

We are currently looking for freelance / independent contractors to join our community of Data Analyst in Map Applications. This role offers flexible opportunities with competitive rates. The position will allow you to work from home with a schedule that minimizes the impact on your daily routine.

For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Data Analyst in Map Applications, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.

So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you! We are currently looking for freelancers as

This is a freelance, independent contractor position.

About the job
***This position is open to remote work from any location in Spain***

As a Real Time Analyst at our TUI Experience Centre, you will be responsible for managing and ensuring the fulfilment of our service level agreements for various programs.

About The Job

Manage the call volume, daily attendance and program break schedules
Work closely with the operations team to analyse and help improve their delivery processes

Complete root-cause analysis to determine and quantify reasons for forecast variance and recommend changes to enhance forecast accuracy and effectiveness

Career progression opportunities in more than 50 countries worldwide
Develop yourself as part of a friendly, richly diverse and virtual international team
Exceptional approach to your learning - access to free learning platforms & language lessons

TUI Musement is a leading Tours & Activities business. It combines a scalable digital platform with local service delivery, to offer excursions, activities, tickets and transfers in more than 50 countries worldwide. There are over 130,000 ‚Äòthings to do‚Äô in all major holiday and city destinations, which are distributed through B2B partners, via the Musement and TUI websites and direct to TUI customers. We also offer services to cruise lines through Intercruises Shoreside & Port Services in ports worldwide. TUI Musement sold around 10 million excursions, tours and activities delivered by our international colleagues located around the world and is one of the major growth areas of TUI Group.

In 2018, TUI‚Äôs Tours & Activities division acquired Musement, a leading traveltech start-up. Following a two-year transition period, both became one fully integrated business - known as TUI Musement - combining the global reach, strong resources and high quality in-destination service delivery of TUI, with the digital capabilities, agile working methodology and start-up mindset of Musement.

We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA.

job description:
About the job
Oportunidad internacional|Remoto

About Our Client

Edelman Data & Intelligence (DxI) is a global, multidisciplinary research, analytics and data

consultancy with a distinctly human mission. We use data and intelligence to help businesses and

organizations build trusting relationships with people: making communications more authentic,

engagement more exciting and connections more meaningful.

DxI brings together and integrates the necessary people-based PR, communications, social, research

and exogenous data, as well as the technology infrastructure to create, collect, store and manage

first-party data and identity resolution. DxI is comprised of over 350 research specialists, business

scientists, data engineers, behavioral and machine-learning experts and data strategy consultants

based in 15 markets around the world.

Job Description

Contribute to the development of Data Science based projects end to end. This will include:
Business problem definition
Data Strategy (Sourcing/Structure/Hosting)
Collaboration with Data Engineering to build/deploy pipelines
Algorithm Selection / Methodology testing
Engineering solutions to a production code level
Communicating these projects to clients/stakeholders in a way that delivers maximum impact against objectives
Collaborate with product team to scope and land projects & product features
Significantly contribute to innovation and R&D across DxI

The Successful Applicant

Bachelors/Masters Degree in Machine Learning, Mathematics, Statistics or Computer

Science

Strong Applied Machine Learning Experience, Including but not limited to:
Supervised Learning Algorithms: Regressors (Logit, Linear, Lasso, Ridge, GLMs), Tree Based (XGBoost, LightGBM, RF), SVMs, Na√Øve Bayes, Neighbour algorithms, Ensemble techniques.
Clustering: Hierarchical/RFM/Kmeans/HDBScan
Factorization Approaches (NMF/Factorization machines)
Deep Learning Experience, Including some of but not limited to:
Neural Networks (Multi-Layer-Perceptrons, Autoencoders, CNN's, RNN's, LSTM's
Generative Algorithms
Attention based models
Proficient in at least one deep learning framework (Pytorch, Tensorflow, MXNet)
Transfer Learning
NLP Experience, Including some of but not limited to:
Vectorization approaches
Probabilistic models
Deep Learning Language Models
Transformer Models
2+ Years Machine Learning Pipeline Development
Production Level Python
Experience in cloud based deployment frameworks (AWS or GCP based)
Data Engineering experience: Enterprise databases, datalakes, data pipelines, apache SparkNon Technical Requirements
2+ years experience of applying Data Science to commercial problems
Proven track record of delivering high impact projects for clients using data science
Strong Communication skills of converting technical concepts to business solutions
Innovative and collaborative

What's On Offer

Fun first attitudes - because what's the point of doing great work if aren't having fun?
Career pathing on the mind - whether you plan to stay for 2 years or 20 years we put your

development and career goals as a priority

Open space floor plan community - the best research happens with collaboration and

sometimes that includes input from our non-research co-workers

Broader communications exposure - you will get the opportunity to work alongside broader

Edelman teams such as Corporate, Brand, Digital, Assembly, and more

Open minds for new ideas and methodologies - maybe it's not broken, but that doesn't mean

we can't make it better

Level agnostic - doesn't matter if you are the boss or an intern, we are all in this together
Global Reach - we have researchers you can tap into around the world

Contact: Mario Gomez Ballesteros

job description:
About the job
General Information

For our Marketing, Sales and Product Management team, understanding the full potential of our technology and trends in our markets is highly rewarding. In addition, helping customers all over the world improve efficiency, save resources and reduce emissions gives our work a powerful sense of purpose. Working within the Transformers Sales Operations and Global Product Group teams, you will support the decision-making and the implementation of the marketing strategies, providing market and product data from all over the world.

Reporting to the Global Sales Operations and Market Analysis Manager, you will gather, interpret data and analyze results using analytics, research methodologies and statistical techniques, to meet the business needs. Our model of work is hybrid, and the role could be based in Cordoba- Spain or Lodz- Poland.

Responsibilities

Being the person of reference on market intelligence and analytical tools, dashboards and reporting tools.

Developing and maintaining reports and dashboards.

Enhancing data collection procedures.

Provide ad-hoc analysis based on business needs.

Participate in the Global Target Setting and Market outlook processes, by analyzing order estimates, forecast models, market size /shares, segments and channels.

Evaluate and share customer research, market conditions and competitor analysis.

Support the key strategic initiatives of the specific product group.

Developing prediction systems and machine learning algorithms Data quality. Processing, cleansing, and validating the integrity of data to be used for analysis Master Data and product portfolio analysis and support.

Living core values of safety and integrity, which means taking responsibility for your own actions while caring for your colleagues and the business

Your Background

Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent qualification. Advanced analytical, statistical (SPSS,SAS) and programmable skills (SQL) with experience collecting, organizing, analyzing, and disseminating abundant information with accuracy.

Excellent MS Excel/PowerPoint/PowerBI/SharePoint skills.

Experience in M&S tools (SFDC, STRATOS..) highly appreciated

Good marketing and sales experience (product knowledge and market drivers may help a lot while working on market estimation models)

Proactive and highly motivated to work in international teams. A collaborative, solutions-oriented approach and strong communication skills.

Fluency in English language both written and oral.

2-3 years of proven experience as Data Analyst or Data Scientist

Basic Info Location Cordoba, Cordoba, Spain

Madrid, Spain

Lodz, Lodz, Poland

job description:
About the job
If saving the world is your destiny, but lycra suits are not your thing, this is the place for you!

We are expanding our teams in the defence sector to work in data fusion-related projects.

We¬¥ll get to the point; we'll tell you what's not on the web. If you want to know more about us go to GMV website

WHAT CHALLENGE WILL YOU BE TAKING ON?

We are looking for a dynamic and eager to learn person to develop a project in the field of data fusion. The project will focus on two parts, on the one hand, the generation of training data and simulators and on the other hand, the experimentation and development of algorithms.

WHAT DO WE NEED IN OUR TEAM?

For this position, we are looking for graduates with a background and interest in Machine Learning. In addition, we need you to have knowledge in:

Programming languages such as C/C++, Python, R...
Machine learning
Simulator interoperability
Data fusion algorithms (Kalman, JPDA, particle filters, ...)
Deep learning in the field of images

WHAT DO WE OFFER?

üïë Hybrid working model and 8 weeks per year of teleworking outside your usual geographical area.

üíª Flexible start and finish times, and intensive working hours Fridays and in summer.

üöÄ Personalized career plan development, training and language learning support.

üåç National and international mobility. Do you come from another country? We can offer you a relocation package.

üí∞ Competitive compensation with ongoing reviews, flexible compensation and discount on brands.

üí™Wellbeing program: Health, dental and accident insurance; free fruit and coffee, physical, mental and financialhealth training, and much more!

‚ö†Ô∏è In our recruitment processes you will always have telephone and personal contact, face-to-face or online, with our talent acquisition team. ‚ù§Ô∏èWe promote equal opportunities in recruitment, and we are committed to inclusion and diversity.

WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? JOIN US

If you have any questions please do not hesitate to contact Azahara Marcos Miguel, in charge of this vacancy.

Azahara Marcos Miguel
